La señora Norma es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltera. Ella es comerciante con 2 años de experiencia en el rubro, viene de una familia muy humilde y trabajadora, tiene un Copetín, que está ubicado dentro del predio de la Terminal, el cual tiene mucha afluencia de gente.
Comenta que gracias a su negocio ella puede mantener su casa y todos los gastos que ello implica, por medio de su esfuerzo y gracias a su buena atención, su pequeño local cada vez le trae más ganancias, por eso es que quiere seguir invirtiendo en el, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas, golosinas, galletitas y demás con lo cual podrá abastecer su local.
Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Norma is from the city of Curuguaty; she’s single.  She’s a merchant with two years’ experience in her line of work.  She comes from a very humble, hardworking family.  She has a snack bar located on the property of the bus station which sees a lot of foot traffic.

She comments that thanks to her business she’s able to support her household and all the expenses that entails.  Through her effort and thanks to the good service, her small locale produces more profits every time and this is why she wants to continue to invest in it and why she’s asking for the loan: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, cookies and the rest to stock her shop.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, snacks, cookies and others.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, Lydia has operated a business selling household items at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She also operates a motorcycle repairs business which provides her with another source of income. 

Lydia plans to use this KES 10,000 loan to purchase household items and motorcycle spare parts for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase household items and motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has operated her grocery store in Ndunyu Njeru for the last three years. She is 48 years old and has 3 school-going children.  

Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to expand her grocery store by buying more assorted vegetables. She wants to create more space for stock in which she has seen a growing demand.

In the future, Jane hopes to become one of the leading grocery vendors in the Ndunyu Njeru area and to earn more income so as to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To  expand her grocery store by buying assorted vegetables

loans.name: Star A Group

texts.en:
Francis takes care of seven children at home. In the recent 2011 season, Francis had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 ½ bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Francis was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to have affordable loan repayment. With income from maize sales, Francis will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

Francis is the facilitator of the Star A Group. In the photograph above, Francis is pictured with his group members. The person standing far left is the field officer. Francis and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Star A Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Francis and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more confectionaries.

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 34 years old and is married with three children aged between 1 and 8 years old. She owns a business selling various goods such as beans, cassava, sorghum, etc. The hours of her work are from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Thacienne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more and various goods such as beans, cassava, sorghum, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, she will reinvest in her business and she will be able to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as beans, cassava, sorghum, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items for sale in his garden tools business

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last two years. He is 42 years old, married to Wambui and they have three school-going children.  

Jackson was introduced to KADET through one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm supplies and to pay for labor.

In the future, Jackson hopes to improve his farming methods and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is applying for another loan to start a grocery business. She will use this 50,000 KES loan to purchase vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes and onions for resale. In the future, Mwanaulu hopes to continue improving and expanding her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanaulu has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Harrison Chege

texts.en:
Harrison used his previous loan to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer and to pay casual laborers. He was able to plant and then have a very profitable harvest. Harrison repaid the loan well and in good time.This will be his third loan, which he plans to use to buy farm supplies and to pay for labor.

In the future, Harrison hopes to improve his farming skills and methods, to get  more income and to become one of the leading farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and pay for labor

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. Ruth has operated a retail business selling firewood for 4 years. She works 7 days out of every week, selling her products from home.

Ruth has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of firewood. Ruth also generates additional income through poultry farming and a small retail shop. Ruth's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her businesses are to be come a wholesaler of charcoal and to own 1,500 chickens.

Ruth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics for making clothes.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has operated a transport business in Naivasha for the last 10 years. He is 43 years old, married to Annah and they have two school-going children. 

Samwel was introduced to KADET by one of our credit officers and this will be his second loan. He repaid the previous loan well and in good time. Samwel plans to use this loan to add to his savings to buy a new motorcycle. In the future, Samwel hopes to buy a passenger service vehicle and venture more into the transport industry.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been in the clothing sales business in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years.  He is 37 years old, married to Mary and they have three school-going children.

David was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothing stock for his business. In the future, David hopes to expand his business and become one of the leading clothing dealers in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock for resale

loans.name: Katerin Maricela

texts.es:
Katerin tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en la ciudad de Pilar. Es administradora de un Taller de Costuras,  es la encargada del mismo ya que es una empresa familiar. .
Ella está encargada hace 3 años de la administración,  donde se fabrican: sábanas, fundas, toallas, salidas de baños y todo lo que se refiera a artículos para el hogar.  Nos comenta que su local está bien equipado para que haga sin problemas su negocio. .
Solicitó el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de telas para cumplir con una interesante cantidad de pedidos de su taller; está muy agradecida con  la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que le da de crecer en la productividad de su microempresa.
texts.en:
Katerin is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the city of Pilar. She is in charge of managing a sewing workshop, a family-owned business.

Katerin has been managing this business for three years. She produces bed sheets, pillowcases, towels, bathrobes, and other items for the home. Katerin says that her workshop is well-equipped and that she has not any problems in her business.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fabrics so that she can complete a large number of orders in her workshop. Katerin is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for being given the opportunity to grow so that she can be productive in her microenterprise.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rahab Wanja

texts.en:
Rahab used her previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting. She was able to plant and have a very profitable harvest. Rahab repaid the loan well and in good time.

This will be Rahab's fourth loan, which she plans to use to buy seedlings, fertilizer and spraying chemicals. In the future, Rahab hopes to become among the best farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and spraying chemicals

loans.name: Humberto Cecilio

texts.es: El señor Humberto se dedica  a la construcción, es albañil contratista, es casado y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando, cuenta con casa propia en la zona San Pedro, es cliente antiguo de la institución ya trabajo varias secuencias y demostró puntualidad en sus pagos, el señor se dedica al servicio de construcción y pintura hace varios años, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de material de construcción y pintura por cantidad ya que tiene una obra que entregar, el Sr. Humberto es una persona es un apersona muy trabajadora, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Humberto works in the construction sector as a bricklayer for hire. He is married and has two children who are in school. Humberto owns a home in the District of San Pedro. He is a long-time client of Emprender and has participated in several loan cycles. Humberto has demonstrated that he is punctual with his payments.

He has been providing construction and painting services for several years. The money from this loan will be used to buy construction materials and paint in bulk quantities because he has an outstanding job.

Humberto is a hardworking individual who is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and paint.

loans.name: Esther Wanjiku

texts.en:
Esther used her previous loan to buy dairy cows for rearing and milk production on her farm and, as a result, her income has increased. She repaid the loan well and in good time.

This will be Esther's eighth loan, which she plans to use to buy small heifers for rearing and later reselling. In the future, Esther hopes to venture more into dairy farming, milk production and dairy products, thereby increasing her income and improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy heifers for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa  is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. She has operated a retail shop in Likoni, in Mombasa, for the last ten years. The business is doing well.

This marks Basilisa’s third borrowing from KADET to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock, such as maize and wheat flours, cooking oil and sugar, for her shop.

Basilisa’s clients are mainly from Likoni. She hopes to use the anticipated profits from this loan to repay her loan and to expand her business. Basilisa hopes to do well in business and to have a happy, healthy family.

loans.use: to buy maize and wheat flours, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El señor Tomas es socio y propietario de un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros  en  uno de los sindicatos de choferes de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su movilidad. Vive en casa  propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Tomas se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito que se le otorgo anteriormente ya que le dió la posibilidad de tener mas  ingresos y así ayudar a su familia. Ahora también desea que este segundo crédito sea canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Tomas owns a passenger transport vehicle and is a member of one of the taxi driver unions in the city of La Paz. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tires and to pay for maintenance of his vehicle. Tomas lives in his own home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is married and has four children.

Tomas is very satisfied with the loan he received previously since it gave him the opportunity to earn more income and help his family. He now wants a second loan, which will be funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase drugs for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her motorbike.

loans.name: Violetas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIOLETA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elvira. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de dulces de todos santos, tejido de guantes, manta de vicuñas, tejido de chompas, carpintería, tienda de barrio, venta de tarjetas de llamadas..

La señora Elvira,  indica que hace tres años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las barracas y posteriormente lo venderá en Cochabamba. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Violetas” (Violets) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Elvira. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling food, selling candy for All Saints Day, knitting mittens, making blankets out of vicuña wool, knitting sweaters, carpentry, managing a neighborhood store, and selling calling cards.

Sra. Elvira says that she started working with Pro Mujer three years ago after receiving an invitation from the organization. She currently has a carpentry business where she has worked for many years.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for purchasing wood. She acquires her supplies at the lumber yards and then sells her products in Cochabamba. By working in this manner, she is able to earn income to support her family. Elvira is married and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elvira said that she enjoys working as part of a group.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: La señora Irma se dedica a la venta de ropa al por menor. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería como ser chompas para dar variedad a su mercadería y así satisfacer a la clientela y aprovechando las fiestas de fin de año, donde las ventas casi se duplican. Vive en casa sus  padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de San Pedro en la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un hijo.  Esta será la cuarta vez que acude a Impro para un préstamo y es la segunda vez que desea que su solicitud se envie a Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Irma is a retail merchant who sells clothes. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy merchandise, such as sweaters, so that she will have a variety of merchandise to satisfy her customers. She will also take advantage of the year-end festivities since this is the time when her sales almost double. Irma lives at her parents’ house in the District of San Pedro in the city of La Paz. She is married and has one child.

This will be the fourth time she has approached IMPRO for a loan. In addition, this is the second time that her request has been sent to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sweaters to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of whom are in school. Madina has operated a pub business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Madina has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda. Madina's main business challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and to become a wholesaler. Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, apples, watermelons, melons, and other fruits.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Благодаря последнему кредиту КИВА Виталий приобрел дополнительный участок земли, что позволяет ему расширяться и строить дополнительные теплицы.
На данный момент у Виталия есть две большие построенные теплицы, где он ежегодно садит 4 000 высокорослых помидор. Кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен Виталий планирует использовать для покупки семян и полиэтиленовой пленки, а также постройки теплицы для рассады.
texts.en: Thanks to his last Kiva credit, Vitalyi purchased an additional plot of land, which allows for expansion and building of additional greenhouses.  Currently, Vitalyi has two large completed greenhouses, where he annually plants 4,000 tall tomatoes.  He plans to use this Kiva loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia to buy seeds and plastic and to build a greenhouse for seedlings.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse for seedlings, buy seeds and plastic

loans.name: Misaidi

texts.en:
Misaidi is a married woman with ten children: four of them are working, one is enrolled in school and the other five have passed away. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Misaidi owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her child.

For the past three years, Misaidi has operated a food stall business; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Misaidi faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of owning a hotel in the future.

Misaidi plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase stocks of wheat and maize flours, vegetables, rice, utensils and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of wheat and maize flours, vegetables, rice, utensils and beans.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: La socia tiene varias actividadescomo la agricultura, ella siembra y cosecha maíz; la socia también tiene unos stands en una galería en la ciudad de Cusco y ella se dedica al alquiler de los mismos, la socia apoya en los estudios de sus dos hijos de 24 y 16 años de edad; la socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en el pago de servicios y aumentara animale smenores para la crianza. La socia soliciat el prestamo para invertir en el pago de servicios como luz, agua, telefono y en la compra de pollos para la crianza.
texts.en: This member engages in several business activities, such as planting and harvesting corn.  She also manages a few stands at a shopping center in the city of Cusco and rents out some of them.  The member supports the studies of her two children, ages 24 and 16.  On this occasion, she wants to pay for services and increase the number of small animals that she raises.  Therefore, the member is requesting a loan to invest in the payment of services such as electricity, water, and telephone, as well as purchase chickens to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens and to pay for utilities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer for his college studies.

loans.name: Alfonso Daniel

texts.es:
Alfonso tiene 39 años,  está casado con Carmen de 33 años. El  es albañil  y su señora es artesana. Ambos, por medio de sus esfuerzos comparten los gastos del hogar. 
Alfonso se dedica a la albañilería, hace más de 15 años. Aprendió el oficio de su tío con quien se fue a trabajar en la Argentina después de terminar sus estudios secundarios. 
Actualmente tiene su propia casa, hace como diez años sus trabajos los realiza en forma independiente y con sus propios recursos, hoy en día está trabajando con él un primo a quien le enseña el oficio. Alfonso es muy conocido en la zona por la buena calidad de las obras que hace. 
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una heladera con la que quiere equipar su casa, ya que es muy necesaria para ellos. El dice que le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
Alfonso is 39 years old and married to Carmen, age 33. He is a bricklayer and his wife is an artisan. Both of them, through their efforts, share in the household expenses.

Alfonso has been a bricklayer for more than 15 years. He learned this trade from his uncle and traveled with him to Argentina for work after he finished high school.

Alfonso currently has a home, which he acquired with his own resources after working independently for 10 years. Today he is working with one of his cousins who is learning the trade. Alfonso is well-known in the area because of the high-quality work that he does.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a refrigerator for his home, which his family needs. He says this will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his home.

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella is 42 years old and is married with two children. Drocella owns a secretarial services business. This is her fifth successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 7 am until 7 pm every day. 

Drocella has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase her secretarial services business by buying more equipment like: a printer, machines etc. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To increase her secretarial services business by buying more equipment like: a printer, machines etc.

loans.name: Maria Clelia

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años, vive solo con sus dos hijos en Otavalo en la Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador. María es una persona trabajadora, honesta y luchadora que quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos.

María trabaja sola en una tienda de víveres, solicita el primer crédito a Fodemi ya que necesita invertir en la compra de víveres para su negocio ya que su clientela le pide productos que ella no tiene y pierde ventas y clientes, entonces este crédito ayudará a María a incrementar su negocio y clientes, que le generará muy buenos ingresos que facilitará la mantención de su familia.

Su sueño es poder tener un local propio, y poder comprar electrodomésticos de enfriamiento para productos perecibles.
texts.en:
María is 31 years old and lives alone with her two children in Otavalo, in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador.  María is a hard-working, honest and tenacious person who would like to provide for her children.

María works alone in a grocery store.  She is requesting her first loan from Fodemi as she needs to invest in buying foodstuffs for her business.  Her customers are asking for products that she does not have and so she is losing both sales and customers.  The loan will help her to increase her business and her number of customers.  This will make her very good income with which she can support her family.

María's dream is to own her own premises and to be able to buy cooling appliances for her perishable products.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Ana Milagros

texts.es:
La socia tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija. Ella se sigue dedicando el negocio de venta de ropas para niños y venta de disfraces,la socia vende en forma independiente,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa y disfraces.La socia requiere el préstamo para compara materiales como tela,lanas y palitoa de tejer para que confeccuone las chompas,pantalones y chalinas.     .
  
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: The member is 35 years old and the single mother of a daughter.  She still sells children’s clothes and costumes.  She sells independently and supports her children this way.  She wants to expand and improve the clothes and costume sales business and is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric, yarn and knitting needles to make sweaters, pants and shawls.  She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make her payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothes making supplies.

loans.name: Goya

texts.es: La socia actualmente se dedica  ala agricultura y a la crianza de aniameles menroes, la socia cria pollos y cuyes y luego los vende ella requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de maíz para sembrar y compra de fertilizantes, la socia también desea el prestamo para invertir en la compra de pollos y cuyes para criar y venderlos. Ella desearía a futuro poder crecer economicamnete y dar a sus hijos apoyo en cuanto a sus estudios superiores, la socia desearía tener un terreno de cultivo mas para sembrar maíz. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir enla compra de maíz, fertilizantes, compra de pollos y cuyes para la venta.
texts.en: The member currently works farming and raising small farm animals.  She raises chicks and guinea pigs to then sell.  She needs the loan to buy corn seeds to plant and to buy fertilizer.  She also wants the loan to buy chicks and guinea pigs to raise and then sell.  She’d like to grow economically in the future to provide her children with higher education.  She’d like to have a field to grow more corn.  She’s asking for the loan to buy corn, fertilizers and chicks and guinea pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy corn, fertilizers, chicks and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 50 years old and is married with 5 children aged between 11 and 20 years. She owns a business selling second-hand clothes in the market. She has been in this business for 3 years and the hours of her work are from 8 am until 5.30 pm every day except on Saturday.

Jeanne has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more second-hand clothes to sell. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Bogdana

texts.ru:
Богдана живет в Ивано-Франковске вместе со своим мужем. Она торгует женской одеждой, кофтами, платьями, свитерами, бриджами, юбками, а также мужской одеждой, халатами и т.п. на центральном промышленном рынке «Траян». Богдана всегда предлагает доступные цены и большой ассортимент продукции. На нее работает один наемный рабочий. Торговлей Богдана занимается 5 лет. Более того, 1.5 года назад она открыла торговое агентство «Сани Тур» в центральной части города и стала предоставлять туруслуги местному населению (визовая содействие, отдых и т.д.)

Богдане необходим кредит в размере 14 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить ассортимент мужских и женских халатов и свитеров и удачно их реализовать в этом сезоне, получив дополнительную прибыль. Полученную прибыль она планирует вложить в свой туристический бизнес, к которому всегда лежала душа, ведь Богдана в свое время окончила институт туризма.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Bogdana lives in Ivano-Frankivsk together with her husband.  She sells women's clothing, blouses, dresses, sweaters, breeches, skirts and also men's clothing, robes and the like at the central industrial market, called "Trayan".  Bogdana always offers affordable prices and a wide selection of merchandise.  She employs one person.  Bogdana has been involved in sales for five years.  Besides, she opened a travel agency, called "Sani Tur," in the central part of town one and a half year ago and started to offer travel services to local residents (Visa assistance, vacation, etc.).  Bogdana needs a loan in the sum of 14,000 hryvnia to buy a selection of men's and women's robes and sweaters in order to successfully sell them this season and make an additional profit.  She plans to invest the received profit into her travel business, which she always had a calling for, because after all, she previously graduated from a tourism institute.

loans.use: to buy a selection of men's and women's robes and sweaters in order to successfully sell them this season and make an additional profit

loans.name: Mwanatibu

texts.en:
Mwanatibu is a married woman with one school-going child. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees for her child.

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut selling business; Customers are the local area community members. She dreams of starting a charcoal selling business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase some sacks of charcoal for her new charcoal selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of charcoal for her new charcoal selling business.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es: La señora Bárbara se dedica a la venta de verduras en un mercado de la localidad de Sacaba, se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años y es la actividad con que se sustenta ya que es única fuente de ingresos, la Sra. Bárbara cuenta con casa propia en la zona de Villa Obrajes, tiene 3 hijos que ya son independientes ya casados ella se siente orgullosa ya que sus hijos son personas de bien, con el dinero del crédito comprara verduras y papa por mayor,  ella es una persona muy trabajadora y amable se siente agradecida por la confianza brindada en su persona par la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Bárbara sells vegetables in a market in Sacaba; she’s been in this line of work for several years and it’s what supports her since it’s her only source of income.  Bárbara owns her house located in the Villa Obrajes zone.  She has three children who are independent and married now.  She feels proud that her children are upstanding citizens.  She will use money from the loan to buy vegetables and potatoes at wholesale.  She is a very hardworking, kind person who feels grateful for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and potatoes at wholesale.

loans.name: Ayesa Paola

texts.es:
Ayesa es de la ciudad de luque, vive en casa de sus padres donde tiene una despensa bien surtida. Comenta que gracias a su negocio ella puede ayudar a sus padres y cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen. 
Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, gracias a que tiene muy buena variedad de productos y sumado a eso la buena atención que ella da a los clientes. Uno de sus sueños es seguir creciendo y el día de mañana tener un supermercado bien equipado. 
Ella solicita su crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, lácteos, cárnicos, embutido y otros productos, los cuales le será muy conveniente para abastecer su local, ya que podrá de esa forma podrá cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ayesa is from the city of Luque.  She lives in her parents’ house where she has a well-stocked store.  She comments that thanks to her business she can help her parents cover daily expenses.

She comments that she has a good, regular clientele because she has a good variety of products plus the good service she gives to her customers.  One of her dreams is to continue growing and someday have a well-equipped supermarket.

She is asking for her loan to buy beverages, baked goods, dairy products, meats, cured meats and other products which will be very convenient for stocking her store and be able to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, dairy goods, meat, cured meats and others.

loans.name: Viktoriya

texts.ru:
Виктория замужем, у нее двое сыновей. Она живет в селе Великая Знаменка и торгует женской и мужской одеждой на местном рынке. У Виктории два больших широких киоска, что позволяет значительно расширить ассортимент. Киоски расположены в очень удобном месте на базаре. Так как Знаменка – небольшой городок и рынок там, соответственно, тоже небольшой, спросом там пользуется в основном недорогая практичная одежда, которую и предлагает Виктория.   

Виктория занимается торговлей на рынке уже 8 лет. На данный момент доход от бизнеса составляет около 30 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль не превышает 6 000 гривен в месяц. Виктория хотела бы вложить кредит КИВА  в 15 000 гривен в приобретение зимней партии товара. Перед началом холодов на этот тип товара всегда появляется очень хороший спрос. Виктория долгое время занимается бизнесом, прослеживается постоянное развитие, поиск новых видов товара, приносящих более высокую прибыль. Она работает с широким кругом людей, привозит товар под заказ индивидуально. Ее покупатели всегда довольны обслуживанием, ассортиментом и ценами. В будущем Виктория планирует расширение киоска и сферы влияния.
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Viktoriya is married and has two sons. She lives in the village of Velikaya Znamenka and sells men's and women's clothes at the local market. Viktoriya has two large, wide stalls, which allow her to expand her collection. The stalls are located in a very convenient spot in the market. As Znamenka is a small town, the market there is small as well and the biggest market is for inexpensive, practical clothing- just the type Viktoria offers.

Viktoriya has been trading in the market for 8 years. At this time, the income from her business is around 30,000 hryvnia. Her net income does not exceed 6,000 hryvnia per month. Viktoria would like to receive a Kiva loan of 15,000 to purchase a winter shipment of goods. Before the cold weather begins, this type of product is always in high demand. Viktoria has been in business for a long time and knows there is constant development, looking for new types of goods which bring in even higher profits. She works in a wide circle of people, ordering her goods individually. Her customers are always satisfied with her service, assortment of goods, and prices. In the future, Viktoriya plans to expand the stall and her sphere of influence.

loans.use: Purchase a shipment of winter clothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and is married with 9 children aged between 2 and 17 years old. She owns a mill for milling different products such as: cassava, sorghum, peanut etc. She has been in this business for 3 years and the hours of her work are from 8 am until 6 pm every day.

Grace has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying new materials for her mill to get favorable profits. With the profits, she will be able to save for her future, reinvest in her business, and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for her mill.

loans.name: Elza

texts.es: La socia actualmente se dedica a la administración de su taller de de soldadura junto a su conyugue, la socia también tiene en Huacarpay su cantera de yeso, ella junto a sus pareja  desea invertir en la compra de materiales como fierros para construir su taller y de este modo se mantendra mejor su taller, ella comprara fierros, entre otros materiales para construir su taller.
texts.en: This member currently runs a welding workshop together with her husband.  She also has a plaster quarry in Huacarpay.  Together with her partner, she would like to buy materials such as iron to build her workshop and thereby better maintain it.  She will buy iron and other materials to build her workshop.

loans.use: to buy iron and other materials to build her workshop

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана – из Великой Знаменки. Она занимается выращиванием ранних помидор на своем участке вот уже 8 лет. Ее сын Евгений активно помогает ей в этом, работая на огороде. У Светланы есть 2 больших теплицы. В хозяйство у Светланы вложено 40 000 гривен. На семена и полиэтиленовую пленку у нее в год уходит около 17 000 гривен.

Светлана планирует вложить кредит в 13 000 гривен в постройку новой теплицы для выращивания помидор. Дополнительная просторная теплица даст возможность выращивать более качественные помидоры и притом в большем количестве. В ближайших планах Светланы также провести отопление в теплицы, что становится все более актуально в преддверии холодной зимы. Благодаря успешному ведению сельскохозяйственного бизнеса Светлана смогла в этом году приобрести автомобиль для вывоза помидор. В следующем году это должно помочь при реализации продукции.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Svetlana is from Velikaya Znamenka. She grows early tomatoes on her plot of land for eight years now. Her son Evgeny is actively helping her in this business by working on the field. Svetlana has two big greenhouses. She has invested 40,000 hrivna in her business. She spends around 17,000 hrivna a year on seeds and plastic covers.

Svetlana plans to invest the 13,000 hrivna loan to build a new greenhouse to grow tomatoes. An additional spacy greenhouse will let her grow better quality tomatoes in larger quantities. In her short term goals Svetlana also wants to install heating equipment in her greenhouses which is becoming increasingly important in the run-up to cold winter. Thanks to the successful farming business Svetlana was able to buy a car this year to transport the tomatoes. Next year it should help her to sell the products.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse for growing tomatoes.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Великая Знаменка. Она замужем, воспитала двух сыновей и дочь, которые уже взрослые и живут самостоятельно. Любовь выращивает ранние помидоры вот уже 27 лет. У нее есть 2 большие теплицы, два участка земли. Овощами торгует прямо из дома, который расположен прямо на трассе. В хозяйство у нее вложено 40 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 12 000 гривен. 

Любовь необходим кредит в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы построить новую теплицу для выращивания помидор. Постройка дополнительной теплицы позволит увеличить прибыль. Любовь – пенсионерка, ей очень нравится заниматься фермерством, это то, к чему у нее лежит душа. Она планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес, который является очень перспективным для данного региона.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Lubov is involved in agriculture in the Velikaya Znamenka village.  She is married and raised two sons and a daughter, who are already adults and live independently.  Lubov has been growing early tomatoes for 27 years.  She has two large greenhouses and two plots of land.  She sells vegetables right from her house that is located by a highway.  Lubov has 40,000 hryvnia invested into her business.  Annual expenses for seeds and plastic add up to 12,000 hryvnia.  Lubov needs a loan in the sum of 10,000 hryvnia to build a new greenhouse for growing tomatoes.  Construction of a new greenhouse will allow her to increase her profit.  Lubov is a retiree and likes to be involved in farming very much, as it is something that she has a calling for.  She plans to continue growing her business, which is very promising for this region.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse for growing tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like cooking oil, Irish potatoes, and onions

loans.name: Esthela Segunda

texts.es:
Esthela tiene 63 años vive con su esposo en Otavalo en la Provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador, es una mujer trabajadora, luchadora, sincera y honesta.

Esthela trabaja con su marido en la crianza de pollos, es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi ya que necesita comprar pollos para criar y posteriormente su engorde y venta, proceso que le ayudará a obtener un poco mas de ingresos lo cual le ayudará a mantener a su familia.

Su sueño es poder tener un galpón grande de pollos para poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Esthela is 63 years old and lives with her husband in Otavalo, in Imbabura province, in the north of Ecuador.  She is a hard-working, tenacious, sincere and honest woman.

Esthela works with her husband raising chickens.  This is the first loan she has requested from Fodemi and she needs it to buy chickens to raise, fatten and then sell.  This process will help her to make a little more income which will help her to support her family.

Esthela's dream is to own a large chicken shed so that she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco "MAMACHA DEL CARMEN - VILCABAMBA"; El banco comunal se encuentra situado en el distrito de Vilcamabamba, Provincia de Paucartambo y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio se llama Valentin y es casado, tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 23, 20 años de edad, el socio se dedica  a comprar bosques, el tiene permiso de talr arboles de eucalipto para vender, el socio compra arboles a los diferentes comuneros que son los mismos que se dedican a la siembra de nuevos arboles, el socio compra los bosques y los tala y los translada a los diferentes lugares donde tiene sus clientes para la venta. El socio tambien es agricultor y siembra y cosecha maíz, papa. El socio requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de bosques.

El socio se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Valentin is a member of the 'Mamacha del Carmen - Vilcabamba' community bank which is located in Vilcabamba, in Paucartambo province, in Cusco department.

Valentin is married and has four children aged 26, 24, 23 and 20.  His business is buying woods.  He has a permit to chop down eucalyptus trees to sell.  He buys trees from different members of the community who plant new trees.  He buys his woods, chops them down and then transports them to different places where he has customers to sell to.  Valentin is also a farmer who grows and harvests corn and potatoes.  He needs this loan to invest in buying woods.

Valentin pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy woods

loans.name: Mario Dieter

texts.es: El  señor Mario es cliente antiguo  ingreso  a la institución en el año 2005, siendo un cliente responsable y puntual en sus pagos hasta el momento, el cliente tiene la profesión de odontólogo, soltero  que vive en casa familiar de  sus papas,  el señor Mario se encarga  de  los gastos familiares y   el crédito  lo  invertirá  en la compra de  medicamentos que le ofrecen  de oferta para su consultorio donde atiende a varios clientes ya que es muy conocido por el buen trabajo que realiza,  el siente feliz por la confianza que le brinda la institución nuevamente.
texts.en:
Mario is a longstanding customer who joined the institution in 2005 and has been a responsible client, punctual in his payments, ever since. He works as a dental surgeon, is single, and lives in his parents' house. Mario is in charge of his family's expenses and will use his loan to buy medicine that he can put on sale at his office, where he sees several clients, since he is very well-known for the good work he does. 

He feels happy because of the trust the institution has shown him once again.

loans.use: to buy medicine for his dental office

loans.name: 25 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE OCTUBRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elizabeth. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Comercio, producción y servicios.

La señora Elizabeth,  indica que es primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de cuidado de colegio (portera) y venta de dulces que viene trabajando hace un año atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de dulces), que comprara de la Ceja y posteriormente lo venderá en el colegio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.

En la fotografía falta la senora Celia ya que se fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The communal bank '25 de Octubre' is beginning its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Cascada. It is made up of 8 members under the direction of a board, headed up by a lady called Elizabeth. The businesses carried out by the bank's members are varied and include commerce, production and services.

It is the first time that Elizabeth has worked with Pro Mujer; she became involved through an invitation from a promoter. She currently works as a caretaker looking after a school and, as of a year ago, selling sweets. She will use the money she receives to buy more sweets at the wholesale market which she will then sell at the school. This work provides her with resources to support her family as much as possible, as she lives with her partner and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training.

In the photograph, Celia is missing as she had an appointment with the doctor.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Carmen Eusebia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Carmen; La socia tiene 65 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de lubricentro,pero ahora ha abierto una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceites,por medio de sus negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes y mejorar el negocio de lubricentro.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite al por mayor y tambien para comprar materiales para su lubricentro.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen is 65 years old, married, and has two children.  She still has her business in automotive services, but now she has opened a small grocery store where she sells essential goods like rice, sugar, milk, and oil. Through her businesses, Carmen has given her children a good start in life, and she would like to expand and improve the grocery store business and to improve the automotive business. 

Carmen is asking for a loan for the wholesale buying of goods like rice, sugar, milk, and oil and also to buy supplies for her automotive business. 

She is pleased with the loan she has received and promises to make her payments by the given deadline.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods like rice, sugar, milk, and oil and also to buy supplies for her automotive business.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla lives in Changamwe, Kenya and operates a mobile money transfer shop. The business has been in operation for seven months. She is married and has one child who is in school. 
She learnt about Milango from her friend and decided to join the organization. Priscilla is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase a photocopier machine. 
She looks forward to opening other branches of her mobile money transfer shop, though her main challenge has been the lack of capital. The photocopier will provide additional income while at the same time acting as security/collateral for future loans.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fish and rice.

loans.name: Seline

texts.en:
Seline lives in the Coastal town of Changamwe, Kenya. She is married, has seven children; four are in school. Seline owns a water kiosk/selling point which has been in operation for three years. Besides this, she also operates a furniture shop. 
Seline is applying for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to buy a water tank in order to open another selling point. She is working towards owning more selling points and workshops in the future. Seline’s main challenges have been the lack of capital, pipe breakages, and lack of tanks. 
The additional income obtained from this will be used to pay school fees, renovate her house, and also save for the future.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mbossé

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée.Elle vit chez son mari avec ses deux enfants.Pour participer  à l'entretien de la petite famille et subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle exerce un commerce de produits cosmétiques.Ses produits lui proviennent des pays environnants sur commande et elle les place auprès des  magasins locaux.Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un prêt de 400 000f avec lequel elle va acheter des caisses de parfum, de  lait de beauté, des mèches et d'autres produits  cosmétiques divers.Son ambition est d'installer en centre ville un magasin de vente en gros de produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married woman who lives with her husband and their two children. She sells beauty products to support herself and help with the household responsibilities. She orders her merchandise from surrounding countries to supply local shops. 

In order to strengthen her business, she is seeking a loan of 400,000F to buy cases of perfume, beauty lotion, hair extensions and various other cosmetic products. Her goal is to set up a wholesale store downtown.

loans.use: to buy cases of perfume, beauty lotion, hair extensions and various other cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El socio actualmente se dedica  ala agricultura como principal actividad, el socio tiene sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz, papa; el socio también tiene junto a su conyugue una panadería y juntos estan obteniendo buenos resultados, el socio también tiene una pequeña tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad, el socio desea invertir el prestamo de ahora en la compra de levadura, harina, azucar, y para su pequeña tienda de abarrotes con su conyugue cerveza, es una tienda pequeñita y hay lo basico para consumo diario, el socio desea seguir creciendo y ahorrar para la educacion de sus hijos el desea verlos profesionales. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, azucar, cerveza.
texts.en:
This member currently works in agriculture as his principal activity; he has fields where he grows corn and potatoes.  He also runs a bakery with his wife, and together they've had good results from it.  The member also has a small store selling everyday products.

The member wants to invest the current loan in purchasing yeast, flour and sugar, and also beer for his small grocery store that he runs with his wife.  It is a very small store which just has everyday basics.  The member would like to continue to grow his businesses, and to save money for the education of his children as he would like to see them become professionals.

The member is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing flour, yeast, sugar, and beer.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, sugar and beer.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel es soltero se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida ya que tiene una pensión no tiene hijos y se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzo, el vive en casa familiar en la casa de su mama, ubicado en la zona Oroncota, el préstamo será destinado para  para la compra de mesas y sillas para ampliar su restaurante, es un joven emprendedor con ganas de superación, con el tiempo desea tener un  restaurante mas grande y atender a mas clientela ya que tiene muchos clientes por la buena comida que se prepara en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel is single and has no children. He has a diner where he sells food. Miguel spends his time preparing lunches. He lives in the family home with his mother in the District of Oroncota.

This loan will be used to buy tables and chairs so that he can expand his restaurant. Miguel is a young entrepreneur who has the drive to succeed. In time, he wants to have a large restaurant so that he can serve more customers. He already has many customers because of the good food that he serves in his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Gayceli

texts.es: Gayceli, de 32 años, es una mujer noble. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 4 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Jean Pier al que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Chambará. Su principal objetivo, es mejorar su casa. Pues ya tiene un hijo a quien desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Su esposo trabaja en el gobierno de su localidad, ahí se encargo de los pagos de impuestos y rentas de los pobladores. Recibe un sueldo mensual por ello. Pero como Gayceli, es una mujer responsable, siembra en los terrenos que heredó; papa, maíz, cebada y trigo. Los cuales vende en la feria de Chupaca los días sábados. Además con su esfuerzo pudo abrir una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su zona. Por el momento le va muy bien, tiene la seguridad de que con esfuerzo seguirá concretando sus objetivos. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Gayceli, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado; en mejorar la infraestructura de sus habitaciones, pues está realizado con material sencillo a base de tierra.
texts.en:
Gayceli, 32, is an honest woman. She lives with Juan, her husband of 4 years. They have one son, Juan Pier, who they care for in their own home, located in the Chambará hamlet. Her main goal is to improve her house. She wants to provide her son with a better quality of life. 

Her husband works in the local government. He takes care of tax payments and inhabitants’ rent, for which he receives a monthly salary. 

As for Gayceli, she is a responsible woman. She plants potatos, corn, barley, and wheat in the land that she inherited. She sells the crops in the market in Chupaca on Saturdays.  

Through her effort, she was able to open a grocery store, where she sells basic necessities to the residents of the area. Everything is going well for her at the moment; she has the security that with effort, she will continue realizing her goals. 

This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she hopes to fulfill her plans through this collaboration. She commits to carrying out the payment of her loans. In addition, she is pleased to be a part of the association because the members are responsible and united. Upon receiving the support, Gayceli will invest the money requested in improving the infrastructure of her home, which is made with simple, earth based materials.

loans.use: improve the infrastructure of her home using quality materials

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 25 años es divorciada y tiene un hijo de cuatro años, vive en Atuntaqui en la provincia de Imbabura en el Norte de Ecuador. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora, organizada y no le gusta las injusticias.

Ana trabaja en la confección de ropita para muñecas otavaleñas, solicita el primer crédito a Fodemi ya que necesita invertir en tela salmón para confeccionar la ropa de muñecas ya que se viene una buena temporada para la venta de las muñecas y tiene que tener muy buena producción para que pueda obtener buenos ingresos y así poder mantener a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es seguir trabajando para incrementar su negocio y en un futuro cuando tenga muy buenos ingresos comprarse un terreno y contruir su casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 25 years old, divorced, and has a four-year-old son. She lives in Atuntaqui in the province of Imbabura in northern Ecuador. Ana is a hardworking and organized woman who dislikes injustice.

Ana makes clothing for Otavaleño dolls. She is requesting a loan from FODEMI because she needs to invest in salmon-colored fabric for making doll clothes. The season is approaching when the sales of these dolls are good. By maintaining a high level of production, Ana is able to generate a good income so that she can support her son and improve their quality of life.

Her dream is to continue working so that she can increase her business. In the future when she has good income, Ana will buy a plot of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making doll clothes.

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AZUCENAS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Achacachi, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Celia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras y frutas, venta de maní, venta de pasancallas, venta de comidas. 

La señora Celia  indica que es la primera ves que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas desde años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su mercadería (compra de frutas que comprará de La Paz y lo comercializa en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Azucenas” (Lilies) is starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Center. This group consists of 11 members and is directed by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Celia. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as selling fruits and vegetables, selling peanuts, selling candied popcorn, and selling food.

Sra. Celia says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation at a promotional event. She currently has a business selling fruit and has been working for several years.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her inventory. She will buy the fruits in La Paz and then sell them in her community. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. Celia is in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Celia says that she enjoys the training seminars.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, D. 30 años es un hijo responsable. Vive en compañía D. sus 2 hermanas en L. ciudad D. Huancavelica.  Sus padres le encomendaron el cuidado D. sus hermanas, quienes salieron del campo para buscar un mejor futuro en L. ciudad; ahí donD. comenzó Alexander a forjar su futuro. Estudio educación en un instituto, con el tiempo descubrió que su vocación es ser ingeniero civil, por ello se esforzó y postuló a L. universidad del estado, ya le faltan dos años para terminar su carrera y lo que más le gusta es poder ver su sueño realizado. Su actividad económica es el servicio D. Internet y fotocopias que abrió cerca D. L. universidad, ahí obtiene buenas ganancias, pues los estudiantes, son los que más hacen uso D. estos servicios. “Mi tiempo lo tengo que compartir con el estudio, durante las mañanas estoy en L. universidad y durante las tardes en el negocio. Me turno con mis hermanas para no tener que cerrar”, afirma. Ahora su mayor deseo es terminar sus estudios y así ser un profesional. Éste es el segundo crédito con MFP, donD. espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte D. su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Alexander, D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. papeles, y una máquina cortadora, para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 30, is a dutiful son. He lives with his two sisters in the city of of Huancavelica. His parents charged him with the care of his sisters so that they could leave the countrysiD. in search of a better future in the city. It is here that Alexander has started to forge a future of his own. He studied education at an institute and then discovered that he wanted become a civil engineer for his vocation. For this reason, he strived to advance to the state university. He lacks two years before finishing his degree. What he enjoys most is seeing his dream become a reality. Alexander has a business providing Internet and photocopying services near the university. He is able to generate good earnings because the students make use of these services. “I devote the time that I have to my studies. During the mornings, I am at the university and then manage the business in the afternoons. I take turns managing the business with my sisters so that it can always stay open,” he says. Now his greatest wish is to finish his studies and become a professional.

This is his second loan with MFP. Alexander hopes to have everyone’s support so that he can follow through with his plans. He promises to complete his payments. In addition, he is grateful to be part of his Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. Alexander will invest the money he requested in the purchase of paper and a cutting machine for his business.

loans.use: to buy paper and a cutting machine.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La socia actualmente sigue con su negocio de venta de jora, ella compra maíz amarillo y prepara la chicha de jora, la socia  tambien se dedcia  ala crianza de animales menroes y en esta ocasion para incrementar sus ventas requiere invertir el prestamo en la compra de maíz amarillo y en en la compra de gallinas y cuyes; La socia tambien desea comprar alimento para sus animales menores, la socia apoya en los estudios superiores de sus hijos y desea implementar a futuro su local y que sus ganancias crezcan. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de maiz amarillo para la preparacion de chicha de jora, y e la compra de gallinas y cuyes.
texts.en:
Justina now continues with her business of selling “chicha de jora”  (a corn-based drink).  She buys yellow corn and prepares the chicha de jora.

In order to increase her sales, she needs a loan on this occasion to buy yellow corn, hens, and guinea pigs.  She also wants to buy feed for her small animals.

She supports her children’s higher education.  In the future she wishes to implement her place and have her income grow.

She is requesting the loan to buy yellow corn to make chicha de jora.  She will also buy hens and guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy yellow corn to make chicha de jora, hens, and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Wendtoin Group

texts.fr:
Mme Rihanata est le responsable du groupe WENDTOIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 3 enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 4ans.2 vont a l’école et elle a 4 personnes en charge.

Elle est coiffeuse depuis 09ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de bissighin.Ses clients sont les femmes, les filles.

Elle veut s’acheter  02 douzaines  de mèche outré, 02 douzaines  de laine et 10 sachets de perle.

Mme économise ses bénéfices s’acheter une moto. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir un grand salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Madame Rihanata is the leader of the group WENDTOIN. She is married and is the mother to 3 children ranging in age from 4 to 15. Two of her children are in school, and she supports 4 other people.  

She has been a hair stylist for 9 years. She buys supplies in the Bissighin market. Her customers are women and children. 

She wants to buy 2 dozen bags of hair extensions, 2 dozen bags of wool and 10 bags of beads. Madame is saving her earnings to buy a motorcycle. She would like to open a large hair salon.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen bags of hair extensions, 2 dozen bags of wool, and 10 bags of beads

loans.name: Ignasia

texts.es:
la sra. Ignasia tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 3 dependientes, Ignasia se dedica a la caficultura, cuenta con 2 manzanas de café, tiene mucha experiencia en el manejo de la tierra, tambien cuenta con una pulpería en su casa de habitacion,  siendo estas dos actividades la fuente principal de ingresos, Nachita como se le conoce en la aldea,  se caracteriza como una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora.     

Nachita utilizara el credito para la compra de un sistema solar, su casa de habitacion se encuentra en la montaña y se dificulta poder contar con energía eléctrica, servicio muy importante para el desarrollo y educación de las familias, gracias a este panel solar podra iluminarse por las noches y asi podra atender mas tiempo a sus clientes, siempre piensa seguir trabajando con prisma para mejorar su finca y surtir mejor su pulperia cuando termine de cancelar la planta solar.
texts.en:
Sra. Ignacia is 58 years old, married, and has three dependents. She is a coffee grower and has two plots of land for producing this crop. Ignacia has plenty of experience with managing her land. She also operates a grocery store in her home. These two businesses are her main sources of income. Nachita, as she is known in her neighborhood, has a reputation for being a very responsible and hardworking woman.

Nachita will use this loan to buy a solar energy system. Her home is located in the mountains, so it is difficult for her to receive electricity. This service is very important for the development and education of families. Thanks to this solar panel system, Nachita will have light in the evenings so that she can have more time to attend to her customers. She always plans to continue working with Prisma so that she can improve her farm and better stock her store after she finishes the payments on her solar generator.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel system.

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina is a 38-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has eight children between the ages of 25 and 10.  Six of them go to school. 

Perina runs a food store business and she has been in the business for six years. She has no employees. Perina heard about Finance Sudan through the marketing done in the market. She is taking a loan of 800 SDG to purchase more food items like sorghum, maize and cassava. Besides this business, Perina has no other source of income. 

In five years time, Perina would like to hope for an increase in the business size.

Her major challenges include high competition and home expenses.   

Perina says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support in South Sudan.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like sorghum, maize and cassava

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia Moyobamba y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 40 años, y tiene 02 hijas D. 24y 14 años, y un hijo D. 21años, solo la adolescente está a su cargo y cursa el 3 año D. nivel secundario.A partir D. los 16 años empezó a trabajar con la venta D. chupetes, golosinas y kekes en las afueras D. su casa, esto le permitió contar con independencia económica, desD. entonces, la idea D. negocio fue su iniciativa propia, al lado D. su esposo decidieron incursionar en el negocio D. la venta D. lubricantes y aditivos para vehículos ya su esposo es mecánico, también se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. Inicia su negocio con un préstamo D. 2,000.00 nuevos soles.Con este préstamo D. S/.500.00, comprará  insumos como repuestos, lubricantes, aditivos.
Carmen Rosa,es una mujer luchadora  y emprendedora,  su sueño es ampliar su negocio, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Amor y Paz” (Love and Peace) which is located in the District and Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martín. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children: two daughters (ages 24 and 14) and a son (age 21). Her teenage daughter is still under her care and in her third year of high school.

Sixteen years ago, Carmen started working by selling lollipops, candy, and cupcakes outsiD. of her home. This allowed her to be financially independent. Since then, she took the initiative of starting her own business. Carmen and her husband decided to open a business selling vehicle lubricants and additives since he already works as a mechanic. In addition, Carmen sells beauty products. She started this business with a loan of 2000 PEN.

Carmen Rosa is currently requesting a loan of 500 PEN in order to buy supplies such as spare parts, lubricants, and additives. She is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to expand her business.

Carmen is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing opportunities to women like her so that they can make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, lubricants, and additives.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 32 años es un valerosa madre soltera de 3 hijos, a los que sacó adelante. Ahora solo vive con Rocío su hija menor. Juntas viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Saño. Desde niña ayudó a su mamá en la venta de caldos en un espacio que acondicionó por su casa. Ahí aprendió todo lo necesario. Cuando murió su madre, ella continuó con la venta de los alimentos. En todos estos años, obtuvo buenas ganancias, pues es muy conocida. Con el tiempo aparecieron varias personas que se dedicaron al mismo rubro, “la competencia”, afirma. Por eso comenzó a criar animales, como gallinas, cuyes, conejos y cerdos, los cuales comercializa después de engordarlos. Además de pequeñas artesanías llamadas “damasitas” (especie de tambor de madera), esto es lo que más le gusta. Pues tiene que pintar y ser creativa, lo vende en grandes cantidades de acuerdo a pedidos, a un nuevo sol por unidad. Ahora desea ser conocida y así tener mayores ganancias. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Luz, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias cabezas de ganado porcino para su venta.
texts.en:
Luz is 32 years old and a valiant single mother of three children, which is why she tries to get ahead. She currently lives with Rocío, her youngest daughter, in their own home in the town of San Pedro de Saño. When she was a young girl, Luz helped her mother with selling soups from a designated space in their house. This was how she learned what was necessary. When her mother died, she continued to sell food. After all these years, Luz has earned a good income and has become well-known. Several people have also started this type of business and have become “the competition”, according to Luz. For this reason, she began raising animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, rabbits, and pigs to sell after they have been fattened. In addition, Luz produces small handicrafts called “damasitas” (a type of wooden drum) because she enjoys this activity. Making and painting these items allow her to be creative and she can sell large quantities through orders at a unit price of 1 PEN each. Luz would like to receive more recognition so that she can generate more income.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. She hopes to receive everyone’s assistance so that she can follow through with her plans. Luz promises to complete her payments, just as she did with her previous loan. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and support people. Luz will invest the money she requesting in the purchase of several pigs that she can sell.

loans.use: to buy several pigs.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel se dedica a la construcción es albañil contratista, esta casado y tiene un hijo en camino por lo que se siente feliz y motivado, vive en casa de sus suegros ubicado en la zona de Chimboco, el se dedica al servicio de construcción hace 2 años, el préstamo esta destinado para la compra de material de trabajo material de construcción y pinturas, el Sr. Miguel es un joven trabajador con ganas de superación se siente feliz por la oportunidad que se le brinda en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel works in construction as a bricklayer for hire. He is married and has a child on the way, which is why he is both happy and excited. Miguel lives at the home of his in-laws in the District of Chimboco.

He has been providing construction services for two years. This loan will be used to buy construction materials and paints for his work. Sr. Miguel is a hardworking young man who has the drive to succeed. He is happy to have this opportunity of being granted a loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and paints.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a musical instrument and also candies for his new business.

loans.name: Rosario De Fatima

texts.es:
la sra. Rosario de Fátima junto a su esposo han procreado 4 hijos y se dedican a la caficultura,  contando con mas de 5 años de experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de actividad productiva,  poseen 2 manzanas de café de su propiedad y a la vez se dedican al cultivo de granos de básicos, mismos que le generan otros ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Rosario utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, su comunidad esta muy retirada en la montaña y esto dificulta poder contar con energía eléctrica,  servicio que es indispensable para el desarrollo de su familia.
doña Rosario piensa seguir trabajando con prisma para mejorar su finca y optimizar una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Rosario de Fátima and her husband have had four children and they are coffee growers; they have more than five years’ experience running this type of productive activity. They have two manzanas [Central American unit of land measurement] of coffee and they also farm basic grains that generate additional household income.

Rosario will use the loan to buy a solar energy panel.  Her community is very far away in the mountains so it’s difficult to get electricity, an indispensable utility for her family’s development.  Rosario plans to continue working with Prisma to improve her farm and optimize production.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia tiene cuarenta y cuatro años, es casada tiene dos hijos.Vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos.
Ella tiene cinco años de operar su bazar ,el cual está ubicado su casa.En el bazar Leticia vende ropa que ella confecciona, cosméticos, bisutería y otros artículos para el hogar.

Todos los días, desde de las 7 de la mañana hasta las 11, ella cose y hace reparaciones a prendas de vestir. Y al mismo tiempo atiende a los clientes del bazar.Por las tardes atiende el bazar y algunos días viaja a una ciudad cercana a comprar mercadería y materiales.

Leticia ha solicitado un préstamo a Fundación Mujer, para comprar una máquina de coser plana, materia prima para producir prendas y mercadería (bisutería, bolsos, cosmésticos y artículos para el hogar).
Dada la temporada navideña ella identificó la posibilidad de incrementar sus ventas. Con la ayuda del préstamo ,Leticia podrá aprovechar el incremento en la demanda durante dicha época.

En un futuro Leticia sueña con trasaladar su negocio al centro de la ciudad, con mayor número de clientes,que permitirán mayor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Leticia, 44, is married and has two children; she lives with her husband and one of her children.  She has been running her store for five years; it’s home-based.  Leticia sells clothes that she makes herself in her store and also cosmetics, costume jewelry and other items for the home.

Every day from 7 in the morning until 11 she sews and does clothing repairs.  At the same time she takes care of store customers.  In the afternoon she tends to the store and on some days travels to a nearby city to buy merchandise and materials.

Leticia has asked Fundación Mujer for a loan to buy a sewing machine and raw materials to make clothes and merchandise (costume jewelry, purses, cosmetics and items for the home).  She identifies the Christmas season as a time of possibly increasing sales.  With help from the loan Leticia will be able to take advantage of increased demand during this season.  In the future, Leticia dreams with moving her business to the center of the city where there are more customers that will allow for greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, thread and costume jewelry to sell in her store.

loans.name: Antonia
