Con el dinero del crédito comprará semillas de arvejas con 800 soles, con lo restante adquirirá abono de granja.
texts.en:
33-year-old Susy is a tenacious single mother.  She has a 13-year-old daughter who is in the city of Lima studying.  Susy lives in her parents' home in Tapo-Tarma district.  She owns her own farmland where she grows crops with the help of staff who she hires.  She grows potatoes, peas, beans and carrots and sells her crops in the wholesale market in Tarma.  Susy learned this business from her parents, aunts and uncles, who she watched working the land since she was a young girl.  "I grow a bit of everything.  Everything I grow makes me good money, especially the potatoes and peas" she comments.  In this way, she is able to send a certain amount of money each month to her daughter and help support her parents in providing for the household.  In all the time she has been a farmer, Susy's main problem in continuing to work has been a lack of capital.  For this reason, she limited herself to growing a small quantity of vegetables.  She handled this situation with the support of family members and loans.  This mother hopes to save up enough money to travel to Lima and live there alongside her daughter, without neglecting her parents.

This will be Susy's eighth loan from MFP, to whom she feels grateful for the support they have given her.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time.  WIth her loan money, Susy will buy pea seeds for 800 soles and she will use the rest to obtain barnyard manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and pea seeds

loans.name: Heliodoro

texts.es:
Don Heliodoro tiene 66 años de edad, esta casado y actualmente tiene 6 hijos que dependen de él, su actividad principal es la caficultura, cuenta con más de 30 años en el manejo y cultivo de café, esta actividad ha sido la fuente de ingresos que recibe anualmente para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Don Heliodoro utilizara el credito para comprarse un panel de energia Solar y poder tener iluminada su casa ya que ha sido un deseo de él y de toda su familia poder gozar de este servicio, las posibilidades de que tengan energía eléctrica son bien remotas y toda su vida se ha iluminado con candiles y en ocasiones con velas.
gracias a este panel solar podran mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Heliodoro is 66 years old, married, and currently has six children who are dependent on him.  His main business activity is coffee growing.  He has been growing coffee for more than 30 years.  This business has been a yearly source of income which has enabled him to cover his family expenses.

Heliodoro will use his loan to buy a solar panel so that he can light his house.  It has been his wish, and that of his whole family, to be able to enjoy this service.  The possibility of having electricity is very remote and he has lit his home with oil lamps, and occasionally candles, his whole life.  Thanks to this solar panel, he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Efrain sigue dedicándose a la ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Efraín paga puntual sus cuotas no tuvo ningún problema con el anterior crédito sino al contrario le fue muy bien.   

Efrain requiere el préstamo para comprar un ganado y alimento para hacer engordar sus animales. 

Efrain se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Efrain continues to participate in the “Ricchary  Runa” communal bank of the Asociación  Arariwa in the city of Cuzco. At present, Efrain continues to work with cattle. He has been in this business for several years and it is going well for her. Efraín makes his payments on time and had no problems with the previous loan her had. To the contrary, it went very well for him.   

Efrain requires the loan to buy a head of cattle and feed to fatten up his animals. 

Efrain is grateful for the opportunity that has been offered in this way and is committed to making his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy a head of cattle and feed to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter tiene 34 años, convive con su pareja hace 10 años, con la que crían a 3 hijos menores de 8 años. Esta familia vive en el Barrio de Santo Domingo en el distrito de Tapo. Walter se dedica a la agricultura, en los terrenos de cultivo que se ubican en su propia comunidad siembra: arvejas, habas y papas, productos que negocia los días de feria en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Sus cosechas se venden al instante y son trasladados a la ciudad de Lima, en su mayoría, por compradores que viajan hasta la zona. De esa manera ha podido mantener a su joven familia y darles a sus hijos una educación decente en la escuela de su comunidad. “Si conviene trabajar en la tierra, pero hay días de pérdidas también, por ejemplo hace 5 años perdí 2 hectáreas de papas por culpa del hielo”, explica, advirtiendo que gracias a ese problema aprendió a cuidar sus cultivos con más tenacidad. Walter espera, con el tiempo extender sus terrenos y abarcar más sembríos. Así también anhela brindarles a sus pequeños hijos la educación que él, por falta de dinero no pudo acceder. “Mis hijos son lo más valioso que puedo tener, por ellos seguiré trabajando”, menciona. Éste sería su préstamo número 8 de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las mensualidades. A la vez agradece a la entidad y a su banco comunal por la oportunidad de crecimiento que le muestran en el camino. Con el dinero del crédito, Walter comprará semillas de papas y bolsas de abonos. Calcula que no pasará de 2000 soles, con lo que le sobre pagará el servicio de transporte y mano de obra; todo esto para la próxima cosecha de mayo.
texts.en: Walter is 34 years old. He has lived with his spouse for 10 years and together they are raising three children under 8. This family lives in the Santo Domingo neighborhood in the Tapo district. Walter works in agriculture on cropland located in his own community. He plants peas, beans and potatoes, products that he sells on market days in the wholesalers' market in Tama. His crops sell right away and most are taken to the city of Lima for buyers who travel to that area. In this way, he has been able to support his young family and give his children a decent education in their community's school. " It's good to work the earth, but there are days with losses too. For example, 5 years ago, I lost 2 hectares of potatoes due to frost", he explains. He notes that thanks to that problem he learned to take care of his crops more tenaciously. Walter hopes to in time expand his land and plants more crops. He also wants to give his young children the education that he, due to lack of money, had no access to. "My children are the most valuable thing I can have. For them I will keep working", he remarks. This would be his 8th loan with MFP. For this is reason, he is committed to making his payments on time. At the same time, he is grateful to the organization and to his communal bank for the growth opportunity they have shown him along the way. With the money from the loan, Walter will buy potato seed and sacks of fertilizer. He calculates that it won't be more than 2000 soles, and with what is left over he will pay for the transportation service and labor costs. This is all for his next crop in May.

loans.use: to buy seeds and sacks of fertilizer as well as hire workers and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Wilker

texts.es: Wilker, de 22 años es un joven soltero y visionario. Vive con sus padres en una casa propia en el distrito de Huasahuasi. Como sus padres y abuelos, Wilker ha visto en la agricultura su manera de vivir, de desarrollarse y crecer. En las parcelas que obtuvo como legado de sus padres siembra papa, arvejas y habas principalmente, siendo estos productos los que al venderlos más ingresos le genera.  Además de ser un diestro en las labores del campo, es un buen negociante: “acá en Tarma el kilo de papa se vende a 0.50 céntimos, pero en Lima pagan 1 sol”, explica, por esa razón Wilker viaja constantemente con sus productos. Allí en la ciudad capital, ya tiene compradores fijos, a los que contacta con anterioridad. Uno de los factores que dificultó su negocio fue, la falta de capital para invertir en abonos y fertilizantes, por ello, tuvo que recurrir a préstamo de familiares. Con el tiempo, él quisiera compartir su vida con una mujer luchadora como él, y tener una familia, para eso, seguirá trabajando por que sabe que eso significará mas responsabilidades. Con su ayuda, Wilker podrá acceder a su préstamo número 12 de MFP, se muestra convencido al decir que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. En cuanto a su banco comunal, confía en el trabajo en equipo, sabe que juntos podrán lograr grandes cosas, para él y su comunidad. Con el dinero del crédito, conseguirá comprar fertilizantes de 110 soles la bolsa, y estima que necesitará alrededor de 10 bolsas.
texts.en:
22-year-old Wilker is a single and visionary young man.  He lives with his parents, in their home which they own, in Huasahuasi district.  Like his parents and grandparents, Wilker has seen farming as his way of making of a living, developing and growing.  On plots of land that were handed down to him from his parents, he mainly grows potatoes, peas and beans.  These crops are the ones that make him most income when he sells them.  In addition to being skilled in farm work, Wilker is also a good businessman: "In Tarma, potatoes sell for 0.50 cents a kilo but in Lima they pay 1 sol" he explains.  For this reason, Wilker constantly travels with his produce.  Over in the capital city he has regular buyers who he contacts in advance.  One of the factors that has made his work difficult is a lack of capital to invest in manure and fertilizers.  As a result, he has had to turn to loans from family members.  Over time, he would like to share his life with a woman as tenacious as himself and have a family.  For this reason, he will continue to work because he knows that this will mean more responsibilities.

With your help, Wilker will be able to receive his twelfth loan from MFP.  He says that he will be punctual in making his repayments.  As regards his community bank, he trusts in their team work and knows that together they can achieve big things both for him and his community.  With his loan money, Wilker will buy fertilizers for 110 soles a bag and estimates that he will need around 10 bags.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Roque Manuel

texts.es:
Roque  es una hombre casado de 46 años  y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad. el señor Roque trabaja en el servicio de transporte haciendo taxi en una moto alquilada, sus hijos cursan el nivel inicial.
Él es un buen trabajador, que se esfuerza todos los días por sacar adelante a su familia. 
Roque empezó su negocio en el año 2008 en el transporte. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y 7 días a la semana.. No ha tenido créditos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1300 que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Roque invertirá su crédito para la compra de su propia moto. También su crédito permitirá a Roque a pensar en el futuro y el sueña con tener su propia casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y puede pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Roque is a married man, aged 46. He has two children, aged 4 and 5. Roque provides transportation services as a taxi driver using a rented moto taxi. His children are in primary school.

He is a good worker who works every day to get his family ahead.

Roque started his transportation business in 2008. Every day he works about 12 hours, 7 days a week. He has not had loans before. Roque will use the loan of 1300 nuevos soles that he will receive thanks to Kiva to purchase his own moto taxi. The loan will also allow Roque to think about the future, and he dreams of having his own house and giving his family a better quality of life. His credit assessor believes he is an excellent client and can make his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase his own moto taxi

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 56 años está casado con Reyda hace 28 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 son independientes. En su casa propia viven él y su esposa, su hija, su yerno y 2 nietos. La agricultura ha siso y será la actividad que lo mantendrá, a él y su familia, pues con todos estos años ha aprendido a negociar sus productos. En las parcelas de su propiedad, siembra papas de las variedades: “de color” y “única”, siendo éstas las más solicitadas. Además de arvejas de las variedades: “super mejorada”, “otrillo” y “rondo”. El trabajo del campo significa para Manuel, algo más que un sustento, es un entretenimiento, un arte, una dedicación. Sus plantas son cuidadas con cariño. Del mismo modo se dedica  ala compra y venta de ganado vacuno: toros y vacas; los que pasta y engorda, obteniendo de ganancia alrededor de 200 soles por cabeza. A la vez vende la leche que sus vacas producen ya sea para el consumo directo  para la elaboración de quesos y otros. Manuel se ve con la agricultura hasta el final de sus días, desea ampliar sus terrenos de producción y generar más ganancias. “Aquí nací y aquí moriré”, cuenta entre risas. Con su ayuda, Manuel accedería a su préstamo número 13 de MFP, por esa razón se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. “Santo Domingo de Tapo” es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que siente respaldo y confianza. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de semillas de arvejas y abonos de granja. Ahí destinará como 370 soles por bolsa de 25 kilos. Confía en que le sobrará el dinero para pagar la mano de obra para el proceso de siembra, cultivo y cosecha de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Manuel is 56 years old.  He has been married to Reyda for the last 28 years, and together they have four children of whom three are financially independent.  Manuel lives in his own home with with his wife, his daughter and son-in-law, and two grandchildren.  

Agriculture has been, and will be, the activity that keeps him and his family, and over the course of all these years he has learned the agriculture business.  He grows potatoes of the "de color" and "única" varieties on the parcels of land on his property, as these are the types that are most requested.  He also grows peas of the "super mejorada", "otrillo" and "rondo" varieties.  

Working in the fields signifies more to Manuel than just a means of sustenance.  It is a recreation, an art, a dedication.  His plants are tended with love.  He brings the same approach to his work buying and selling cattle, both bulls and cows.  He puts the cattle to pasture and fattens them up, obtaining earnings of about 200 soles per head.  At the same time, he sells the milk produced by his cows for either direct consumption, or for making cheese and other things.

Manuel sees himself working in agriculture until the end of his days.  He wants to expand his farming lands and generate more earnings.  "Here I was born, and here I will die", he tells us between laughs.  

With your help, Manuel will receive his 13th loan with MFP, and so he agrees to be punctual with his repayments.  “Santo Domingo de Tapo” is the name of his communal bank, in which he feels trust and confidence.  He will invest the money from his loan in purchasing pea seeds and farmyard manure.  He has allocated 370 soles for each 25 kilo bag.  The remaining money will be used to pay for labor for sowing, tending and harvesting his land.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds, sacks of manure and to hire workers.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz Daria, una joven de 18 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus papas y 3 hermanos en una casa propia en el distrito de Huasahuasi. A su corta edad, luz Daría ya se inició en el mundo de los negocios. Se lo agradece a sus padres por las enseñanzas y por los terrenos que recibió para desenvolverse como agricultora.
De esa manera en sus parcelas, crecen plantas verdes y sanas de papa, arvejas, zanahorias, lechugas y habas.
Cada una de sus verduras tiene distintos meses de producción, “si en enero cultivo las papas cosecho zanahorias, y si en octubre cultivo verduras ya estoy vendiendo arvejas, así no me descuido”, explica.
En este trabajo duro, la apoyan sus padres y hermanos, pero como son terrenos heredados, ella se hace cargo si no cuenta con personal disponible. Por ejemplo contrata operarios o jornaleros a quienes paga al día por limpiar, remover y cosechar.  Luz Daría tiene sus metas claras, “quiero juntar algo de dinero y estudiar secretariado ejecutivo y contabilidad”, acota con la confianza de tener la juventud necesaria para lograrlo. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 que obtendría de MFP. Se muestra convencida de que pagará con puntualidad sus cuotas. Su banco comunal se llama “San Juan” y se siente contenta al ser parte de éste. Con el dinero del crédito comprará 10 bolsas de abonos orgánicos, cuyo precio asciende a los 1200 soles, con lo restante adquirirá semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Luz Daria, a young woman of 18, is single, and lives with her parents and three brothers in their own house in Huasihuasi district. At her young age, Luz Daria has already taken her first steps in the world of business.  

She is thankful to her parents for what they've taught her and for the land she received to fend for herself as a farmer.  That is how green and healthy plants grow on her plots; potatoes, peas, carrots, lettuce and lima beans.  

Each one of her vegetables has different months of production, "If in January I'm growing potatoes, I'm harvesting carrots, and if I'm growing vegetables in October, I'm already selling peas; so I don't overlook anything", she explains. 

Her parents and brothers support her in this hard work, but as the land is hers by inheritance, she is the one who takes charge if she doesn't have a crew available. For example, she hires hands or day laborers, who she pays by the day to clear, till, and harvest. 

Luz Daria has clear goals. "I want to save some money and study to be an executive secretary or accounting, she says, with the confidence of being young enough to achieve it. 

This would be her 12th loan from MFP. She is confident that she will pay her instalments on time. Her communal bank is called "San Juan", and she feels happy to be part of it. With the loan money, she will buy ten sacks of organic fertilizer, the price of which amounts to 1,200 soles. With the remainder she will buy pea seeds.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of fertilizer, and pea seeds.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Irma sigue dedicándose a la venta de carne. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Irma paga puntual sus cuotas no tuvo ningún problema con el anterior crédito sino al contrario le fue muy bien.   

Irma requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chancho. 

Irma se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Irma continues to participate in the "Ricchary Runa" communal bank, of Asociación Arariwa, in the city of Cusco. Currently, Irma continues to sell meat. She has worked in this business for several years now, and it's going very well. 

Irma pays her instalments on time, and had no problem with the previous loan; on the contrary, it went very well.  Irma needs the loan to buy pork. Irma is thankful for the opportunity she has been provided in this way, and is committed to paying her scheduled instalments on time.

loans.use: To buy pork.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José solicita un crédito para realizar compostura a una de sus maquinas de impresión y además comprar de materia prima como es tinta y papel, así podrá darles un buen servicio a sus clientes. 
Don José  tiene su negocio desde hace doce años y su esposa le ayuda atendiendo el negocio cuando el sr José esta realizando los trabajos que tiene que entregar. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio planea pagar el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan to have one of his printing machines fixed and to buy raw materials for his activity such as ink and paper in order to offer a good service to his customers.
José has been running his activity for twelve years, and his wife helps him by working in the shop when José is preparing the orders he needs to deliver.
He intends to repay the loan with part of the income he earns from his activity, which is the main source of income he has to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and to pay for the fixing of one printing machine.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Actualmente, Luz Marina sigue dedicándose hacer masajes en una institución privada y tambien lo hace de forma particular. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Luz Marina paga puntual sus cuotas no tuvo ningún problema con el anterior crédito sino al contrario le fue muy bien.   

Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para mantenimiento de su casa. 

Luz Marina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Luz Marina continues to participate in the "Ricchary Runa" communal bank in the city of Cusco. Currently, Luz Marina continues to do massages in a private facility, and also does it on her own.  She has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well. 

Luz Marina pays her instalments on time, and had no problem with the previous loan; on the contrary, it went very well.  Luz Marina needs the loan to maintain her house. Luz Marina is thankful for the opportunity she has been provided in this way, and is committed to making her instalment payments on time.

loans.use: To maintain her house.

loans.name: Yolinda

texts.es:
Yolinda tiene 20 años, hace 3 años que convive con Javier de 24 años. Ambos ya tienen una hija de 2 años llamada Maybet. Esta joven familia vive en un hogar propio en el anexo de San Juan, distrito de Huasahuasi. A su corta edad, aprendió a trabajar la tierra. Ella y Javier cuentan con terrenos propios, en ellos siembran papas y arvejas de la variedad “criolla”, cosecha que lleva al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. 
Así también se dedica a la elaboración de quesos, para ello utiliza suministros como: leche, cuajo de carnero y sal.  A la quincena está ofreciendo 20 quesos los que vende a 6 soles en su comunidad y a 10 soles en la ciudad de Tarma. Comenta que ambas actividades le son favorables, por que para mientras la siembra espera como 5 meses para la cosecha, ya va obteniendo otros ingresos con la venta de quesos.
Además Javier trabaja como operario en terrenos agrícolas ajenos, de los que cobra 25 soles al día. 
Yolinda, menciona que su familia aun tiene que vivir mucho, por ello espera crecer con su negocio, ampliar su producción de papas y arvejas, contactar más clientes, etc. Éste sería su préstamo número 12 de MFP, anteriormente fue puntual con sus pagos, y ahora también piensa serlo. Con respecto a su banco comunal, manifiesta sentirse contenta y respaldada. El dinero del crédito lo destinará en la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para la cosecha del mes de abril, en el cual invertirá 1500 soles aproximadamente y con lo restante pagará los servicios de operarios.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 20, and has been living with her partner, Javier, 24, for three years.  They have a two year-old daughter named Maybet. This young family lives in their own home in the settlement of San Juan, in Huasahuasi district. 

At a young age, she learned to work the land. She and Javier have their own land, and there they grow potatoes and "criollo" variety green peas. They take their harvest to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. They also make cheeses, using ingredients such as milk, lamb rennet, and salt. Every two weeks they sell 20 cheeses, that they sell in their community for six soles, and for ten soles in Tarma.

Both activities benefit her. The plants take five months to harvest, and in the meantime, she is earning other income from selling cheese. In addition, Javier works as laborer on other people's farms, and earns 25 soles a day. 
 
Yolinda says that her family has many years ahead, so she hopes to increase her business, expanding her production of potatoes and green peas, and attracting more customers. 

This would be her 12th loan with MFP. In the past she has made her payments on time, and intends to do so now also. Regarding her communal bank, she says she feels happy and supported. 

The loan money will be used to buy organic fertilizers for the April harvest, in which she will invest approximately 1,500 soles. With the remainder, she will pay for laborers.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer, and hire laborers.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María es socia nueva del banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Rosa María nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 25 años de edad, ella estudia la carrera profesional de contabilidad en una universidad privada y a la vez trabaja como asistente contable en un estudio contable. 

Rosa María requiere el préstamo para gastos personales específicamente para pagar su matrícula de la universidad. 

Rosa María se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (En la fotografía la socia Rosa María esta vestida de casaca de color celeste y acompañada de su hermana).
texts.en:
Rosa María is a new member of Asociación Arariwa's "Ricchary Runa" community bank which is located in the city of Cusco.

Rosa María was born in the city of Cusco and is 25 years old.  She is studying for a professional degree in accountancy at a private university.  At the same time, she is working as a junior accountant in an accountant's office.

Rosa María needs this loan to cover personal expenses, specifically to pay her university registration fees.

Rosa María is grateful for the opportunity that she is being given and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.  (In the photograph, Rosa María is wearing a sky-blue jacket and is accompanied by her sister).

loans.use: to cover personal expenses, specifically to pay her university registration fees

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.es: Este Grupo solidario se llama San Marcos, está conformado por las señoras Saturnina, Marina y Basilia van a comprar con su préstamo barro, tierra blanca, leña, greta para elaborar jarros, cazuelas y macetas, el señor Víctor va a comprar leña, barro, greta y pintura para elaborar cazuelas. La señora Marina tiene 40 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 2 hijos 1 estudia la secundaria y el otro ya trabaja, ella trabaja la alfarería elabora macetas y cazuelas de barro, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar barro, tierra blanca y leña, ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años, es herencia de sus abuelitos, ella veía como sus papas trabajaban el barro y le llamaba la atención y comenzaba también a elaborar las cazuelas, su negocio es importante para ir pasando la vida para trabajar y sacar ingresos para sostener a la familia, ella se siente orgullosa de ser artesana de seguir con este trabajo de sus antepasado, su negocio es popular porque en su pueblo elaboran cazuelas, jarros, olla, macetas de barro de buena calidad, ella utiliza las ganancias en invertir en los materiales para seguir trabajando, en la comida, el jabón y en la escuela de su hijo. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar loza para revender y que a sus hijos no les falte calzado, uniformes ropa y buena salud. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Les damos las gracias por la confianza que nos tienen al darnos este préstamo y no vamos a quedar mal, gracias por ayudarnos a crecer los negocios y las familias.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'San Marcos'.  Saturnina, Marina and Basilia are members of the bank and they will use their loan to buy clay and white clay to make pitchers, casserole dishes and flowerpots.  Víctor will buy firewood, clay and paint to make casserole dishes. 

Marina is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  One of her children is attending high school and the other is already working.  Marina makes pottery.  She makes flowerpots and clay casserole dishes.  She is requesting her loan to buy clay, white clay and firewood.  She started her business 20 years ago (an inheritance from her grandparents).  She saw how her mom and dad worked the clay and it drew her attention.  She started making casserole dishes too.   Marina's business is important as it enables her to work and make income to support her family.  She feels proud to be a craftswoman and to carry on this work which was done by her ancestors.  Her business is popular because in her village they make good-quality casserole dishes, pitchers, pots and flowerpots.  Marina uses her profits to invest in materials so that she can continue working.  She also spends them on food, soap and school for her son.  Her hopes and dreams are to buy pottery to resell and for her children to never lack shoes, uniforms, clothes and good health.  The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the trust that you are placing in us by giving us this loan.  We won't let you down.  Thank you for helping us to grow our businesses and families".

loans.use: to buy clay, white clay and firewood for making flowerpots and casserole dishes

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia y su esposo son originarios de la ciudad de Veracruz cuentan con diez años radicando en Nuevo Laredo, su esposo elabora como chofer de un camión de trasportar personal de trabajos. Cuentan con una hija de seis años y que esta estudiando la primaria y desean darle lo mejor. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía que es zapatos de invierno y ropa de invierno, y así tendrá mayor ingreso y más variedad de mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia and her husband are natives of Veracruz and have been living in Nuevo Laredo for 10 years. Her husband works as a driver, transporting work staff. They have a six year old daughter who is studying in primary school and they want to give her the best.

Julia is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of winter merchandise, shoes and clothing, so that she will have a higher income and a greater variety of goods to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase new winter merchandise.

loans.name: Fernando Victor

texts.es:
FERNANDO S. vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business

Fernando es un hombre soltero de 34 años de edad, él  trabaja en la venta de comida (hamburguesas, pollo frito, salchipapas) y gaseosas.
Él es un hombre trabajador, que se esfuerza todos los días por sacar adelante a su familia. 
Fernando empezó su negocio en el año 2008 en la venta de comida, ganando semanalmente S/.250 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 6 horas al día y 6 días a la semana.. No ha tenido créditos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500 que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Fernando invertirá su crédito para la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus potajes y ofrecerles a los clientes una mejor atención. También su crédito permitirá a Fernando a pensar en el futuro y él sueña con tener su casa propia y ayudar a su madre que sufre una enfermedad que la aqueja siempre. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y puede pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
FERNANDO S. lives and works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of the Peruvian traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Fernando is single, 34 and he sells food (hamburgers, fried chicken and salchipapas [fried potatoes with hot dog]) and soft drinks. He is a hardworking man who works every day to help his family get ahead. He started his business selling food in 2008, and he earns 250 nuevos soles weekly. He works about 6 hours a day, 6 days a week.

He has never taken out a loan before. He will invest this loan of 1.500 nuevos soles that he will receive, thanks to Kiva, in the purchase of supplies to make his stews and soups and will give his customers better service. The loan will also allow Fernando to think about the future and his dream of owning his own house and helping his mother, who suffers from a long standing illness. His credit counselor believes he is an excellent client and will be able to make his payments promptly.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the preparation of his dishes.

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Jorge es parte del grupo “Abejitas Trabajadoras” dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que consideran a este insecto como muy trabajador. el tiene 32 años de edad el es originario de una población donde su principal actividad económica es el cultivo de guayaba, el esta casado y tiene dos niños los cuales estudian la primaria, el se dedica desde muy joven a la elaboración de pan, pero hace 4 años de independizo para aportar económicamente a su casa, para que así le deje un poco mas de ganancias, dice que su familia fueron los que le enseñaron hacer los panes de diferentes como las deliciosas chilindrinas, donas, conchas, espejos, teleras, cuernitos y muchas mas variedades. Dice que a muy temprana hora se levanta para elaborarlo desde las 4 de la mañana, el vende en su población el pan ya en varias tiendas tiene pedidos y esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar materia prima como harina, leche, huevo, azúcar, gas, colorantes etc. dice que en especial en el mes de noviembre hace lo que son los panes de muerto que son muy vendidos debido a que en el país se festeja el día de muerto. El esta muy contento por que le harán el crédito por que así tendrá insumos para hacer sus panes deliciosos, la meta de Jorge es hacer otro horno de lodo ya que así saben mas sabrosos los panes y se cosen con leña y les da un sabor diferente.
Los otros once integrantes se llaman Gloria,  Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Alma Delia, Sandra, Georgina todos ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para invertirlo en sus negocios como venta de zapatos, mueblería, dulcería, bordados de prendas artesanales, florería, antojitos, cosméticos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Jorge is part of the “Abejitas Trabajadoras” (Little Worker Bees) communal bank and says that they gave the group that name because they consider the insect to be very hardworking. He is 32 and a native of a town where the principal economic activity is guava cultivation. He is married and has two children, who are in primary school. He has worked, from a very young age, as a baker, but four years ago he branched out on his own in order to provide economically for his household and earn a bit more income. He notes that it was his family who taught him how to make different kinds of breads such as the delicious chilindrinas (sugar coated buns), doughnuts, conchas (sweet buns), espejos (large, glazed cookies ), teleras (a type of bread), cuernitos (croissants) and many other varieties. 

Jorge says that he gets up at a very early hour, at about 4 in the morning, to do his baking. He sells his bread in the city, since various stores have already placed orders. He is asking for a loan to buy basic ingredients such as flour, milk, eggs, sugar, cooking gas, food coloring, etc. He says that, especially in the month of November, he makes bread for the Day of the Dead, since the Day of the Dead holiday is celebrated in the country. He is very pleased that they will give him a loan because then he will have the supplies needed to make his delicious breads. Jorge’s goal is to own another mud oven because the bread has a more delicious taste and it is cooked with wood which gives it a different flavor.

The other eleven members of the communal bank are Gloria, Cristina, Elizabeth, Rosa, Mariana, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Alma Delia, Sandra, Georgina. They are all requesting loans to invest in their businesses selling items such as shoes, furniture, sweets, embroidered handicrafts, flowers, appetizers and cosmetics by catalog.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients for bread-making.

loans.name: Lindana W / G Group

texts.en:
Selina takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Selina had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Selina was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Selina will invest in livestock rearing and buy more land to allow saving for future use.

Selina is the facilitator of the Lindana W/G group. She is in the photograph with her group members. Selina and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Lindana W/G group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Selina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: La Villita De San Marcos Group

texts.es:
Marisol cuenta 32 años de edad, es casada  tiene 3 hijos los cuales se encuentra estudiando Roberto e Iván están estudiando la secundaria, José Gabriel está cursando la primaria, su esposo se llama Roberto él trabaja de albañil.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende tamales y elotes, lo cual invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar los tamales y los elotes, ella tiene poco tiempo que está trabajando su negocio pero ella dice que le gusta su trabajo y espera sacar adelante ya que de su trabajo ayuda a sus hijos con los gastos de la escuela, doña Marisol espera que su incremente un poco ya que quiere comprar un carrito para vender y estar mas cómoda ya que ahora lo esta haciendo en una carretilla.

Marisol pertenece al grapo la villita de san marcos el cual está integrado por 10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres todas están realizando una actividad comercial a continuación serán mencionadas:

Martiana, Tomasa, María Elena, Cira, Eneima, Isabel, Elsa, Reyna, y María Eva, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: productos de abarrotes, comida, pescados, refrescos, agua de garrafón, pan, tamales, etc.
texts.en:
Marisol is 32 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.  Roberto and Iván are in high school and José Gabriel is in elementary school.  Marisol's husband is called Roberto and he works as a builder.

Marisol works selling tamales and grilled corn.  She will invest her loan in buying the supplies that she uses to make her tamales and corn.  She has not been working in her business for long but she says that she enjoys her work and hopes to make progress because, through her work, she helps her children with their school expenses.  Marisol hopes to increase her business a little as she would like to buy a van from which to make her sales.  She will be more comfortable because right now she is making her sales from a hand cart.

Marisol belongs to the 'La Villita de San Marcos' group which has 10 members.  They are all women and they are all engaged in their own business activities.  The members are Martiana, Tomasa, María Elena, Cira, Eneima, Isabel, Elsa, Reyna and María Eva.  Their businesses include selling groceries, food, fish, soft drinks, demijohns of water, bread, tamales, etc.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as vegetables, mayonnaise, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Hadija takes care of eight children at home. In the recent 2011 season, Hadija had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hadija was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½ an acre of land. She joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. With income from maize sales, Hadija will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Hadija is the facilitator of the Tumaini Group. In the photograph above, Hadija is pictured with her group members. Hadija and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Tumaini Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hadija and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

George and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Mashanga Water Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Esther will ensure food security for her family and invest in livestock rearing to save for future use.

Esther is the facilitator of the Sweet SHG Group. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph. Esther and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Sweet SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Esther and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, canned goods, soap, soft drinks, and sweets.

texts.en:
Anthony takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children and grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Anthony had a very good maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Anthony was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Anthony will send his children to school and ensure food security.

Anthony is the facilitator of the Lutazo Group. He is pictured in the photograph with his group members. Anthony and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Lutazo Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Greetings from Sinoko Group in Western Kenya!

In the recent 2011 season, Eunice had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega S H G Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bega Kwa Bega SHG Group in Western Kenya!  

Alice takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Alice will invest in business.

Alice is the facilitator of the Bega Kwa Bega SHG group. The photograph shows the group members. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Bega Kwa Bega SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: La Asuncion Group

texts.es: Este Grupo solidario se llama La Asunción está conformado por las señoras Paulina Fulgencia, Paula Esmeralda y Raquel Yolanda van a comprar con su préstamo tamarindo, amaranto, cacahuate, azúcar, piloncillo, miel, papel para elaborar dulces típicos, las señoras Adilene Verónica y Yolanda Minerva van a comprar harina, aceite, pintura, bolsas, lija para elaborar obleas. La señora Raquel Yolanda tiene 39 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos todos están estudiando, ella elabora dulces típicos de la región palanquetas, de alegría y cacahuate, tamarindo, jamoncillo,  ella solicito su préstamo para comprar alegría, cacahuate, piloncillo, cereal, azúcar y miel para tener en existencia material para trabajar, ella inicio su negocio hace 15 años en su localidad todos elaboran dulces, sus papas le enseñaron a elaborar los dulces, ella inicio con créditos que les daban los proveedores donde compraba la mercancía, ella vende sus dulces en las ferias de los pueblos con los peregrinos y visitantes. Su negocio es importante porque a ella le gusta elaborar los dulces para tener más mercado, su negocio le proporciona ingresos para cubrir todos sus gastos, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son costos elevados en el azúcar y el cacahuate, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar la materia prima para ir trabajando. Sus sueños y esperanzas son crecer su negocio y que sus hijos sigan estudiando y logren lo que se propongan. Las integrantes del grupo agradecen a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad sus prestamos gracias a su ayuda podemos crecer los negocios.
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'La Asunción' and its members are Paulina Fulgencia, Paula Esmeralda and Raquel Yolanda, who will use their loans to buy tamarind, amaranth, peanuts, sugar, brown sugar, honey and paper for making traditional sweet treats, and Adilene Verónica and Yolanda Minerva, who will buy flour, oil, dyes and bags for making wafer cookies. 

Raquel Yolanda is 39 years old.  She lives together with her common-law husband and has four children who are all in school.  She makes traditional, regional sweet treats such as 'palanquetas', 'alegrías', peanut, tamarind and 'jamoncillo'.  She requested her loan to buy peanuts, brown sugar, cereal, sugar and honey so that she can have a better stock of supplies available with which to work.  Raquel Yolanda started her business 15 years ago.  In her town, everybody makes sweet treats and she was taught by her parents.  She started out with loans from the suppliers from whom she bought her merchandise.  She sells her sweet treats in the markets in the villages with pilgrims and visitors.  Her business is important.  She enjoys making her sweet treats and hopes to gain more of the market.  Her business provides her with the income she needs to cover all her needs.  The challenges that she faces in her business are the high prices of sugar and peanuts.  She is happy to be receiving this loan which she will use to buy raw materials so that she can continue working.  Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and for her children to continue studying and achieve the goals they set for themselves.  The members of this group thank Kiva and Fundación Realidad for their loans because thanks to their help, they are able to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy amaranth, sugar, brown sugar, peanuts, honey and paper for making sweet treats

loans.name: Khuenjanga Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khuenjanga Group in Western Kenya!

Alice  takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Alice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Alice was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Alice will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

Alice is the facilitator of the Khuenjanga Group.The photograph shows members of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Khuenjanga Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alice  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence owns a tailoring shop in Kongowea, Kenya. The business has been in operation for twenty years. She is married and has five children, three of whom are in school. Florence also owns a mobile money transfer shop. 

Florence joined Milango this year after an invitation from her friend. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy materials for her tailoring shop and add capital into her mobile money shop.

There is usually a low season in February and this is the only challenge to Florence. The additional income from this business will help her to improve her family's standard of living and pay for her children’s school fees.

Among her future plans are to open various mobile money transfer shops and to contract schools to supply school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring shop and add capital to her mobile money shop

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Génesis” lo conforman 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran, venta de ropa, comida preparada, preparación de pan amasado y repuestos de vehículos. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de La Serena.
Carol delegada D. grupo D. Banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila y está ubicada en el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda. Su cabello es corto y su color es castaño oscuro, viste jeans y una polera estampada. Ella se dedica al rubro D. comercio desde hace siete años. Específicamente vende artículos de paquetería, bazar y ropa. 
Sus productos los vende puerta a puerta y en ferias libres.
Comenta que se ha capacitado en micro emprendimiento y caja bancaria. Con esto ha aprendido diversas estrategias para organizar su negocio. 
Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito comprará poleras y juguetes, especialmente para la temporada de navidad. 
Las metas en su negocio son instalarse en un local establecido y habilitarlo al interior de su casa, para esto se encuentra ahorrando para construir el espacio físico de su local.
Carol vive junto a sus tres hijos de 19, 17 y 11 años de edad. Comenta que su hijo mayor estudia en la Universidad la carrera de ingeniería en computación informática. El sueño de Carol es que sus hijos sean profesionales y en futuro puedan crear una empresa familiar. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además disfruta de las reuniones realizadas con los demás emprendedores y comenta que son muy responsables. 
La Serena es una ciudad al norte de Chile, ubicada en la  Región de Coquimbo, provincia de Elqui. 
Es un importante sitio turístico, especialmente durante el verano, donde la gente va a visitar sus playas. La ciudad se dedica principalmente al sector de los servicios, habiendo varios bancos e instituciones financieras y una variada oferta gastronómica y hotelera. En las últimas décadas, el turismo se ha convertido en unas de las actividades económicas más importantes, además la ciudad es paso obligatorio de cientos de cruceros que arriban a la ciudad de Coquimbo, en donde en La Serena encuentran el lugar de residencia provisoria para visitar la zona y el V. de Elqui.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Genesis" and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in various professions including clothing sales, food preparation,  baking homemade bread, and spare parts for cars.  They all live in the city of La Serena.  

Carol is the director of the communal bank and appears in the front row in the photo and is the first person from right to left.  She has short, dark brown hair and is wearing jeans and a printed shirt.  She has been a merchant for seven years.  She sells packaging materials, trinkets and clothing.  She sells her produts door to door and in the open air markets.  She says that she has been trained in micro business and finances.  She has learned diverse strategies for organizing her business.  She buys her merchandise from distributors in the city of Santiago.  With the loan she will buy t-shirts and toys, especially for the Christmas season.  Her goals are to set up an established locale for her business and to furnish the interior of her house.  She is saving for the construction of her locale. 

Carol lives with her three children ages, 19, 17 and 11.  She says that her oldest son studies at the university, majoring in computer engineering.  Carol's dream is that her children become professionals and in the future, are able start a family business.  She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business.  In addition, she enjoys the meetings with the other entrepreneurs and says they are very responsible.  

La Serena is a city in the northern part of Chile, located in the Coquimbo region in the province of Elqui.  It is an important tourist site, especially during the summer when people visit the beaches.  The city is primarily dedicated to the service industry as they have various banks and financial institutions and they offer diverse cuisine and hotel accommodations.  In the last few decades, tourism has become one of the most important economic activities.  In addition, the city is a mandatory stop for hundreds of cruise ships that arrive in the city of Coquimbo where La Serena is the temporary residence for visiting the area and the Elqui Valley.

loans.use: purchase t-shirts and toys, especially for the holiday season.

texts.en:

Grace takes care of 15 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Grace had a good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Grace was only able to harvest five bags of maize on that land. 

With income from maize sales, Grace will educate her children and ensure food security for her family. 

In 2012, the members of the Merry Fellowship group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.name: Doris Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Dora es madre soletera, vive junto con sus padres, Dora tiene 34 años de edad y su actividad principal es la caficultura, tiene experiencia en le manejo del café y esta actividad ha sido la fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Doña Dora utilizara el credito para comprar un sistema de energia Solar, nunca ha gozado del servicio de energía eléctrica y ahora más que nunca lo necesita por que sus padres ya están de edad avanzada y tiene miedo que de noche en la oscuridad se vayan a caer por que no tienen con que alumbrarse.
texts.en:
Dora is a single mother who lives with her parents. Dora is 34 years old and her principal economic activity is growing coffee beans. She has much experience in cultivating coffee trees and this activity has been her source of income for covering household expenses.

Dora will utilize the loan to buy a solar energy system. She has never had electrical energy service and now more than ever, she needs it because her parents are advanced in age and she fears that they may fall in the dark at night for lack of lighting.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es: Saúl, tiene la edad  de 65 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende compra la semilla e insumos para la asistencia de la siembra. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de cultivo por lo cual lo sembrara. El cuenta con la experiencia de varios años de edad en el cuido y manejo de esta plantación. El con la siembra de este cultivo pretende generar el máximo de ganancias con la explotación del terreno para así mejorar su nivel de vida y su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
65-year old Saúl is married and lives with his wife and their five children. His family is the focus of his life. With the loan he plans to buy seeds and fertilizer to spread on his crops.

Saúl owns land which is very suitable for growing crops. He has several years of experience looking after and managing his farm. He expects to get a good profit from the harvest and will use the money to improve the standard of living and wellbeing of his family.

This is Saúl’s first loan from FUDECOSUR and he has not had any others with state banks. FUDECOSUR has provided him with better credit terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow maize

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica de 25 años es una madre soltera de una niña de 6 años. Ella y Yamila, su hija, viven en una casa propia en el distrito de San Luis de Shuaro. Mónica nació en el seno de una familia agricultora. Por esa razón aprendió las labores del campo. En sus parcelas de terrenos cultiva café y plátanos. “El café se cosecha una vez al año, pero con el plátano ya tenemos 2 cosechas al mes”, menciona. Con el apoyo de personal al que contrata, para las labores del campo, puede darse el lujo de atender un pequeño negocio en donde expende productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, carnes, gaseosas, etc. De esa manera cuida a su hija dentro de su casa. Mónica considera rentable la siembra del plátano, ya que la arroba la vende a 6 soles, y cada quincena cosecha 30 arrobas. Por su parte, con el café obtiene ingresos mayores. Las 4 parcelas de terrenos le ofrecen 60 sacos de café de 100 kilos. Cada kilo lo vende de 10 a 15 soles. “Depende de la temporada”, puntualiza. Con el tiempo, esta abnegada madre, quiere consolidar su negocio y no descuidar sus cultivos. Además anhela ver a su hija, educarse en buenos colegios. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 de MFP, por lo que confía en que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas designadas. “Los Cafetaleros”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que afirma sentirse cómoda y a gusto. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, los que consistirán en sacos de arroz, azúcar, carnes, conservas, gaseosas, etc.
texts.en:
25-year old Mónica is the single mother of a 6-year old daughter called Yamila. They live in their own house in the district of San Luis de Shuaro. Mónica was born into a farming family so she learned how to work the land. She grows coffee and bananas in her fields.

“Coffee is harvested once per year,” Mónica explains, “but we harvest bananas twice per month.” With help from labourers on contract to do the farm work, she can afford the time to run a small business selling basics such as rice, sugar, meat, and soft drinks. This allows her to look after her daughter in the house.

Mónica says that bananas are a profitable crop as she sells an arroba (unit of weight between 11 and 16 kg depending on the region) for 6 soles, and she harvests 30 arrobas every two weeks. The profits from coffee are even greater. From her four parcels of land she gets sixty 100 kilo bags. Each kilo sells for 10-15 soles depending on the season.

As time passes, this disciplined woman wishes to put her business on a more sound footing while not neglecting her farm. As well, her greatest wish is to see her daughter educated in good schools. 

This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she is confident that she will be able to make the repayments on time. “Los Cafetaleros” is the name of her community bank, and she notes that she feels comfortable with the group and enjoys being with them. She plans to use the loan to buy merchandise such as bags of rice, sugar, meat, canned food, and soft drinks for her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, canned food, and soft drinks

loans.name: Gennsi

texts.es:
Gennsi de 23 años de edad, es un joven soltero. Vive en la casa de sus padres con 2 hermanos menores de 14 y 12 años. Sus padres le enseñaron lo duro y gratificante que puede ser trabajar en el campo. Inició las actividades dentro del campo ayudando a sus padres. Ahora cuenta con terrenos propios y con el aprendizaje en sus pocos años de vida ha podido cultivar en 2 parcelas de terrenos diversos productos como: café, plátanos y yuca. Productos que negocia con destreza. “Aprovecho más las ventas en junio, julio y agosto, en esos meses el kilo de café sube hasta 14 soles, más que el doble de lo normal, me conviene bastante”, manifiesta.
Gennsi, es un joven trabajador y visionario. No piensa en tener familia, por ahora. Confía en sus fuerzas y coraje para desarrollarse como persona en primera instancia. Más adelante piensa comprar un automóvil, lo que le generará ingresos gracias al servicio de transporte que realizará. Con los ahorros piensa adquirir un lote y construir su casa propia. Su camino aún es largo pero no imposible de andar. Con su ayuda, Gennsi accedería a su préstamo número 5 de MFP, por esa razón se muestra convencido que pagará las cuotas con puntualidad. Con respecto a su banco comunal, menciona sentirse satisfecho y esperanzado frente a los años venideros. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos con 800 soles aproximadamente. Lo restante lo destinará al pago de operarios o mano de obra ajena.
texts.en:
23-year old Gennsi is single and lives with his parents and two younger siblings aged 14 and 12. His parents taught him that farming was hard work but very rewarding. He started out by helping his parents in the fields, but now he has his own land. Although he’s only young, he’s learned a lot and grows crops such as coffee, bananas, and yucca on his two parcels of land and then uses his skill as a salesman. “I take advantage of the June, July, and August sales season,” he says. “That’s when a kilo of coffee costs up to 14 soles, more than double the normal price. That works very well for me.”

Gennsi is a hardworking and forward looking young man. He’s not thinking of having a family just yet. He is confident that his energy and courage will enable him to become a person of some standing. In the future he plans to buy a vehicle and use it to generate income as a taxi. With his savings he is thinking of buying a piece of land and building a house on it. His road is long but not impossible. 

Gennsi is now asking for his fifth loan with MFP and is certain that he will make the repayments on time. He is very satisfied with his community bank and is full of hope for the future. He will spend the loan money on bags of organic fertilizer at a cost of approximately 800 soles. The remaining money will be used to pay workers or for other unconnected jobs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay workers

loans.name: Las Mesas Group

texts.es:
Guadalupe cuenta con 43 años de edad, es casada tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando Esteban estudia 3º grado de secundaria, Gloria 4º grado de primaria, y Daniel 2º grado de primaria, su esposo se llama Esteban es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende jugos de frutas como son de naranja, betabel, etc. e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para hacer los jugos y licuados como son: Naranjas, Betabel, Zanahorita, platano etc. ella espera que su préstamo le ayude ya que Guadalupe dice que las ganancias es para ir surtiendo y ayudando a sus hijos con los gastos de la escuela, doña Guadalupe le gustaría que su negocio incrementara un poco mas ya que le gustaría poner un local donde vender sus bebidas.

Guadalupe pertenece al grupo  las mesas el cual está integrado por 10 personas las cuales todas son mujeres a continuación serán mencionada:
Adoración, Lourdes, Manuela, Norma, Austreberta, Humbelina, Magdalena, Inés, Vicenta todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de artículos de bisutería, pozole, jugos, huaraches, mariscos, accesorios como son: garras, cinturones, sombreros, etc.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children, all of them students. Esteban is in his 3rd year of secondary; Gloria is in the 4th grade of primary; and Daniel is in the 2nd grade of primary. Her husband Esteban is a farm worker.

Guadalupe sells fruit juices including orange, beet, etc., and she will invest her loan in buying the supplies she needs to make juices and fruit drinks like orange, beet, carrot, plantain, etc. She says that the loan will help to pay the school expenses of her children. Guadalupe would like to see her store expand a little more, and she wants to construct a stall where she could sell her drinks.

Guadalupe belongs to the Las Mesas Group, composed of 10 women: Adoracion, Lourdes, Manuela, Norma, Austreberta, Humbelina, Magdalena, Ines, Vicenta [and Guadalupe]. Each of them has her own commercial business, selling things like costume jewelry, 'pozole' (a popular stew using hominy), games, sandals, shell fish, and accessories like caps, belts, hats, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruit for making juices and fruit drinks to sell.

loans.name: Las Nenas Group

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 49 años de edad y es parte del grupo “Las Nenas” dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que una de sus integrantes se le ocurrió por que dice que la mujer no es fea nada mas falta que se arregle y por eso le puso ese nombre al grupo. Ella divorciada y tubo 4 hijos los cuales están casados, ella se dedica a vender colchas, zapatos, bolsas por catalogo y de diferentes marcas desde hace 5 años, dice que ella emprendió su negocio para ayudarse con sus gastos de la casa y aunque sus hijos la apoyan económicamente ella quiere sentirse útil y por eso tiene su negocio de venta de blancos y zapatos. Platica que a diario va a vender los zapatos y las colchas a sus conocidas y como ya tiene clientas a veces van a su casa y ya nada mas piden los catálogos y le hacen los encargos y cuando tiene artículos en existencia se los ofrece y los vende. Dice que ella va a surtirse en su localidad en diferentes distribuidores autorizados. Ahorita doña Gloria esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en pedidos que tiene con sus clientas y dice que una de sus metas es hacer crecer su negocio, ella quisiera vender bisutería y joyería fina nada más que primero quiere ahorrar para poder invertir en diferentes modelos de joyería.
Las otras 10 integrantes del grupo se llaman Virginia, Kati, Catalina, Alma Yanet, Lizbeth, María Minerva, Yolanda, Alicia, María del Socorro y Celia ellas invertirán en diferentes negocios como antojitos, repostería, abarrotes, bisutería, dulcería, zapatos por catalogo.
texts.en:
Gloria is 49 years old.  She is a member of 'Las Nenas' (The Chicks) community bank.  She says that one of the group's members came up with the name because she pointed out that no woman is ugly, she just needs to fix herself up.  

Gloria is divorced and has four children who are married.  Her business is selling different brands of bedspreads, shoes and handbags through catalogs.  She has been doing this for five years.  She says that she set up her business so that she could help with her household expenses.  Although her children support her financially, she would like to feel useful and so she has her business selling linens and shoes.  She tells us that she goes out to sell her shoes and bedspreads to her acquaintances every day.  Sometimes her customers come to her house and just request the catalogs.  They make their orders and when she has items in stock she offers them and sells them.  She says that she stocks her business from different authorized distributors.  Right now, Gloria is requesting a loan to invest in orders that she has from her customers.  She says that one of her goals is to grow her business.  She would like to sell costume jewelry and fine jewelry but first she would like to save up so that she can invest in different types of jewelry.

The other ten members of this group are Virginia, Kati, Catalina, Alma Yanet, Lizbeth, María Minerva, Yolanda, Alicia, María del Socorro and Celia.  They will invest in their different businesses which include selling Mexican snacks, selling confectionery, selling groceries, selling costume jewelry, selling sweet treats and selling shoes through catalogs.

loans.use: to sell footwear and bedspreads through catalogs

loans.name: Flor De Canela Group

texts.es:
Benito tiene 34 años el es parte del grupo Flor de Canela y dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que a uno de sus compañeros se le ocurrió ese nombre. El  es casado y tiene 3 niños los cuales estudian la primaria, el se dedica a cultivar nopales, chiles manzanos, duraznos, aguacate, zanahorias, papas, lechugas y mas vegetales, el tiene cultivando sus legumbres desde hace 15 años dice que su padre fue que le enseño el amor por la tierra y  dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo, abecés dice que también trabaja en la construcción en su localidad y en la capital de su país donde gana un poco mejor. Plática que el va a vender sus legumbres a la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de el y esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar abonos orgánicos e insecticidas para que sus vegetales se den de mejor calidad. La meta que tiene Benito es comprar planta de aguacate y hacer un huerto grande para vender por mayoreo ya que el tiene muy pocos árboles, dice que el esta muy agradecido por el crédito que le darán por que así la calidad de vida de su familia mejorara.
Los otros tres integrantes del grupo son Reynaldo, Mariana, Virginia ellos invertirán sus créditos en una peletería, en antojitos y en venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada.
texts.en:
Benito is 34 years old and is part of the group "Flor de Canela" or "Cinnamon Flower."  He says that they took that name because it struck one of the members of their group.  Benito is married and has three children who study in elementary school.  He works planting edible cactus, manzano chile peppers, peaches, avocado, carrots, potatoes, lettuce and other vegetables.  He has been cultivating vegetables for the past 15 years and says that his father was the one who taught him his love for the land and he says that he likes his work a lot.  He says that at times he also works in construction in his town and in the capital of his country where he can earn a bit more.  He notes that he is going to sell his vegetables in a central market in a town close to his own and he is asking for credit to purchase organic fertilizers and insecticides so that his vegetables will be of better quality.  Benito's goal is to purchase avocado plants and make a large garden in order to sell in bulk since he currently has very few trees.  He says he is very thankful for the credit that he will be given because it will help him improve the quality of life for his family.  

The other three members of his group are Reynaldo, Mariana and Virginia.  They will invest their loans in a fur shop, in appetizers, and in the selling of seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to plant and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltera y vive con sus padres y hermanos actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar la semilla para la posterior siembra del cultivo y además comprara los insumos para su asistencia.  Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación del cultivo en óptimas condiciones y además quiere utilizar su terreno de forma productiva. Ella con todos estos planes tiene como meta generar el máximo de ganancias que se pueda para poder salir adelante con sus planes y mejorar su nivel económico de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Andrea, 19, is single living with her parents and siblings at present.  She intends to use the loan to buy seeds to later plant and also to buy farm supplies to help the crops along.  She has a piece of land that’s apt for planting in optimal conditions and she wants to use it in a productive way.  All her plans are geared to maximizing profits so that she can get ahead with her plans and improve her family’s standard of living.  This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and FUDECOSUR offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients she uses.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucía tiene 68 años D. edad, está felizmente casada con José, con quien tiene 9 hijos. D. ellos solo 1 está en su poder, ya que los demás tienen sus propias familias. Vive en su casa propia en el distrito D. San Luis D. Shuaro. Lucía, desD. pequeña, se dedica a las labores del campo. Aprendió a trabajar arduamente gracias a la influencia D. japoneses y nativos D. su zona. Lucía es huérfana, pero como su vida inició lejos D. sus familiares ahora, a su edad pueD. disfrutar D. una amplia familia, pues sus 9 hijos le dieron 33 nietos. “Me siento contenta y recompensada con mi familia”, menciona. Cuenta con terrenos agrícolas propios, en ellos produce café, plátanos y palta; D. los que obtiene buenas ganancias. Así también, esta dulce abuelita, tiene un negocio en el que venD. abarrotes, ropa, artículos D. cocina, zapatos, etc. Este negocio ha crecido, ya que Lucía inició esta actividad desD. los 19 años. “Al día obtengo, con suerte, 120 soles y cada 15 días compro la mercadería para mi tienda, me va bien”, explica. Con el tiempo, no podrá esforzarse demasiado en sus sembríos, así que continuará con su bodega. Espera ver felices a sus hijos y nietos, a los que apoya económicamente frente a cualquier situación. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 D. MFP, por esa razón promete ser puntual en los pagos, como lo fue anteriormente. En cuanto a su trabajo con su banco comunal, muestra alegría y confianza entro del grupo, por que la mayoría son familiares suyos. Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio. Comprará ropa y algunos artículos para la campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Lucía, 68, is happily married to José; they have nine children.  Only one of them is still in their care because the others have already formed their own families.  She lives in her own house in San Luis D. Shuaro District.  

Since she was a little girl, Lucía has worked in the fields.  She learned to work hard thanks to the influence of the Japanese people and of people native to her zone.  Lucía is an orphan and even though her life began far from relatives she can now enjoy a large family because her nine children have given her 33 grandchildren.  “I feel happy and rewarded with my family,” she mentions.  

She owns farmland where she grows coffee, bananas and avocadoes that produce good profits.  In addition, this sweet grandmother has a business selling groceries, clothes, kitchenware, shoes, etc.  This business has grown since Lucía started it when she was 19 years old.  “If I’m lucky, I earn 120 soles daily and every two weeks I buy merchandise for my store; I’m doing well,” she explains.  In time, she will no longer be able to exert much effort anymore in her fields so she will continue with her store.  She hopes to see her children and grandchildren happy; she supports them economically in face of any situation.

This will be MFP loan #5 for her so she commits to being punctual with her payments like she’s been previously.  As far as work in the communal bank is concerned, she displays joy and trust within the group because most of them are her relatives.  She will use the money from the loan to buy merchandise for her store.  She will buy clothes and some items for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes and Christmas-themed items for the home.

loans.name: Anturio Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Anturio está conformado por la señora María Mercedes va a comprar arroz, aceite, guajillo, queso, pan molido,  la señora Carmen va a comprar jitomates, tomates, chiles, plátanos, sandia, melón, la señora Francisca va a comprar sabanas y colchas, la señora Eloísa va a comprar maquillajes, rubores, perfumes y cremas, la señora Rosario va a comprar refrescos por caja y semilla por kilo.
