Rosendo fishes and sells fish called: "Chupadora", and "Baron", to the people who come to his village.  This young entrepreneur prioritizes his development as a person, increasing his planting and improving his production.  In the future he will have a family but this is not in his plans at the moment.  This will be the first time that Rosendo requests a loan with MFP.  He feels happy to belong to the communal bank.  Thus, he promises to be punctual in making the payments and responsible in the activities of the group.  He will use the loan to pay the people who work his fields, in the “porcado” (forming dirt around the plants) and in weeding (cleaning the crops).

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Mazatl Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Mazatl esta integrado por trece mujeres, ellos viven en una comunidad lejana en la sima de un cerro, sus principales actividades economicas son el cultivo de cafe, naranja y maiz, la mayoria de los habitantes de esta comunidad hablan el dialecto Nahuatl y le han puesto el nombre de Mazatl a su grupo que es una palabra en nahuatl que significa Venado.

La señora Heriberta es uno de los integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene la edad de 45 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Victor que trabaja en el campo, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales ya estan casados.

Doñña heriberta platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y hace un poco mas de 18 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de pollo para ganar un poco de dinero extra  y asi poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Ella realiza sus ventas todos los dias desde su hogar se levanta temprano para aliniar su pollo y saca una pequeña mesa la cual pone en la parte de enfrente de su casa y pone en una bandeja su pollo y conforme va pasando el dia sus clientes van a su negocio ha hacerle el gastos.

ella nececita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de pollos para ppoder realizar sus ventas. 

ella dijo"Gracias a la fundacion Realidad por venir hasta nuestra localidad a brindarnos estos prestamos"

Tambien nos dijo que espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que le gustaria a que su negocio continue creciendo y iniciar a vender pan ya que deja buenas ganancias.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Lourdes venta de antojitos mexicanos
Imelda venta de abarrotes 
Elodia Venta de reposteria 
Emma venta de pan 
Beatriz venta de pollo 
Enriqueta venta de pan 
Matilde venta de pollo
Griselda venta de ropa 
Felicitas Venta de refresco 
Maria Geremias venta de pollo 
Susana Venta de refresco 
Nicacia Venta de pan
texts.en:
The “Mazatl” group has 13 women members living in a distant community on a hilltop.  Its main economic activities are growing coffee, oranges and corn.  Most of the residents of this community speak Nahuatl and have called their group Mazatl because in Nahuatl that means “Deer.”

Heriberta is one of the group members.  She’s 45 years old and only completed elementary school.  She’s married to Víctor who works in the fields.  She has four children who are all married already.

Heriberta relates that she’s always enjoyed working and a little over 18 years ago decided to start her own business selling chicken to earn a little extra money to help her husband with the household expenses.

She sells every day at home.  She rises early every day to butcher the chicken and set up a small table in front of her house where she places her tray of chicken.  As the day progresses her customers come by to make their purchases.  She needs the loan to buy chickens so that she can make her sales.

She said:  “Thank you to Fundación Realidad for coming all the way to our location to offer us these loans.”  She also told us that she hopes that her business will prosper with this loan because she’d like her business to continue and to start selling bread because that’s quite profitable.

The other group members are:

Lourdes – Mexican fast food snack sales
Imelda – grocery sales 
Elodia – pastry sales 
Emma – bread sales
Beatriz – chicken sales
Enriqueta - bread sales 
Matilde – chicken sales
Griselda – clothing sales 
Felicitas – soft-drink sales 
María Geremías – chichen sales 
Susana – soft-drink sales 
Nicacia – bread sales

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase sweets, soft drinks, tomatoes, chiles, onion, beans, corn, creme, cheese, beef and chicken, potatoes, bananas and eggs

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
Yuri de 26 años, hace 10 años convive con su pareja, con quien tiene 4 hijos de 11, 8, 5 y 3 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shaoriato. Yuri desde niño se dedica  a las labores del campo. La agricultura es la actividad en la que se desenvuelve con libertad y sabiduría. Gracias a la fertilidad de los suelos y a la destreza en los negocios, está convencido de que saldrá adelante. En las 2 hectáreas de terrenos de su propiedad cultiva kión y en otras 2 café.  “Depende de cómo negocies, por ejemplo el café es más rentable en mayo y abril. El kión en estos meses, no me puedo quejar”, explica. Además comenta que falta de capital fue uno de sus problemas principales para invertir en el pago de operarios. “Pago 15 soles para el macheteo (corte de maleza con el machete), 18 soles para la siembra y 25 para la limpieza del kión”, manifiesta.
Yuri espera ampliar su casa con la construcción de más cuartos, para ello seguirá trabajando igual o más que ahora. Esta sería la primera vez que Yuri contaría con un préstamo de MFP, se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos. En cuanto a su banco comunal:”San Pablo Shima”, se siente contento por que dentro del grupo encuentra amigos confiables. Con el dinero del crédito podrá continuar con las siembras. Invertirá en el pago de personal contratado y algunas bolsas de abonos.
texts.en: Yuri is 26 years old and has been married to his wife for the 10 years. They have four children, ages 11, 8, 5 and 3, and they all live in a home they own in the community of San Pablo de Shaoriato. Since he was a young boy Yuri has made a living working in the fields. Agriculture has given him his freedom and his wisdom. Thanks to the fertility of the soil and his knowledge of the business, he was convinced he could get ahead. He owns two hectares of land on which he cultivates ginger, and has two other hectares where he cultivates coffee. "It depends on the business," he says. "For example coffee is more profitable in May and April. Ginger during these months, I can't complain." Furthermore, he says that a lack of capital is one of biggest problems in investing in his business. "I pay 15 soles for cutting weeds with a machete, 18 for planting and 25 for cleaning the ginger," he says. Yuri wants to expand his house by adding more rooms, and to do that he will keeping working just as hard or even harder. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to be punctual with his payments. In his community bank, "San Pablo Shima", he feels content to be part of a group of trustworthy friends. With the money he is requesting, he will be able to continue his planting by hiring workers and buying some sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to hire workers and buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Los Clavelitos Group

texts.es:
Thelma tiene 30 años de edad y estudio hasta la preparatoria dice que ya no siguió estudio por que se caso, ella es casada con el señor Marco el cual es policía y tiene 2 hijos de nombres María del Carmen y Manuel ambos estudiantes de primaria. Platica que ella es parte del grupo Los Clavelitos y dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo por que antes una de sus integrantes cultivaba esa flor de clavel y por eso le pusieron ese nombre. Ella está pidiendo un préstamo a la financiera para la compra de abarrotes como huevo, jabón, leche, pañales, refrescos, frijoles, suavizantes de tela, papel higiénico, cloro, carnes frías, chiles, etc., ella tiene con su negocio aproximadamente. 5 años, doña Thelma inicio este negocio para tener un ingreso extra para su casa, ella compra sus productos en la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella. El préstamo le beneficiara a su familia ya que con las ganancias que saquen de la venta de abarrotes obtendrán un dinero extra lo cual lo invertirá en la educación de sus hijos. La meta que tiene para su negocio la señora Thelma es tener más mercancía para su tienda, también comprar unos estantes para acomodar sus productos de abarrotes y más adelante hacer un local especialmente para la tienda de abarrotes porque la tiene en su comedor y si le quita espacio.
Las otras cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Yazmín, Tomasa, Marisela y María Esther las cuales ocuparan sus créditos en sus negocios de venta de frutas y verduras, abarrotes y venta de zapatos y colchas por catalogo.
texts.en: Thelma is 30 years old and went to school until high school. She says that she never continued her education because she got married. She is married to Marco, a police officer with whom she has two children, María del Carmen and Manuel, who are both in elementary school. Thelma is part of the Los Clavelitos (The Carnations) group, and says that they named the group that because one of the members used to plant that flower. Thelma is requesting the loan to purchase grocery items such as eggs, soap, milk, bread, soft drinks, beans, fabric softeners, toilet paper, bleach, cold meats, peppers, etc. She has had a general store for about five years and started to business to bring in extra income for her household. She purchases the products at a supply center in a nearby town. The loan will help her family because with the revenue she makes from selling the groceries she will have extra money to pay for her children's education. Thelma's goal is to stock her store with more merchandise as well as purchase some shelves to accommodate the products. In the future, she wants to have a place specifically for her store, since she currently has it set up in her dining room and it takes up a lot of space. The other four members of the group are Yazmín, Tomasa, Marisela and María Esther, who will use the loan for their businesses: selling fruits and vegetables, a grocery store, and selling shoes and bedspreads via catalog.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as eggs, soap, milk, bread, soft drinks, beans, fabric softeners, toilet paper, bleach, cold meats, peppers, etc.

loans.name: Jumiltepec Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Jumiltepec, está conformado por la señora Ana Bertha va a comprar con su préstamo zapatos y catálogos de temporada, la señora Joaquina va a comprar leña, carbón, arroz, aceite, azúcar para elaborar tacos acorazados, la señora Santa Rosa va a comprar flores por mayoreo, la señora Teresita de Jesús va a comprar azúcar, frascos para la venta de miel, la señora María Félix va a comprar aguacate por mayoreo, las señoras María Rachel,  Justina y Esther van a comprar harina, azúcar, el señor Miguel Ángel va a comprar papel higiénico, azúcar, sal, jabón, aceite, refrescos, pan Bimbo, galletas, la señora Aida va a comprar malteada, te, aloe, proteínas. La señora Justina tiene 63 años de edad, ella es viuda tiene 11 hijos, 7 mujeres y 4 varones ya todos trabajan, ella elabora pan de dulce, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar harina, azúcar, manteca, huevo, vainilla, canela y leña para elaborar el pan de dulce, conchas, besos, cemitas, ella inicio su negocio hace 35 años, con los ahorros de su trabajo compro los insumos, ella trabajaba con su tía y veía como elaboraba el pan y aprendió a hacer el pan. Su negocio es importante porque no les hace falta para comer, ella elabora el pan cada 8 días los días jueves y domingos sus hijas le ayudan a elaborar el pan, ella sale a vender sus productos a la ciudad ya tiene a sus clientes de años que ya saben los días que vende, ya vende sus productos y ya tiene dinero para comprar comida y llevarles a sus nietos, ella utiliza las ganancia para pagar deudas, para volver a invertir y para la comida. Sus sueños y esperanzas son vivir bien, tranquila y ser feliz con su familia y lo mejor para sus hijos. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por sus préstamos, estamos agradecidos con ustedes gracias a su ayuda podemos salir adelante con los negocios”.
texts.en:
This communal bank group is called Jumiltepec. It consists of Señora Ana Bertha who with her loan is going to buy shoes and seasonal calalogues;  Señora Joaquina who is going to buy firewood, coal, rice, oil, sugar to make tacos  'acorazados' (battleship tacos are massive corn tortillas with rice and beef - hence the 'battleship' terminology); Señora Santa Rosa is going to buy flowers wholesale; Señora Teresita de Jesús is going to buy sugar and jars for selling honey; Señora María Félix is going to buy avocados wholesale; Señoras María Rachel, Justina y Esther are going to buy sugar, flour; Señor Miguel Ángel is going to buy toilet paper, sugar, salt, soap, oil, soft drinks, Bimbo bread, cookies; Señora Aida is going to buy milkshakes, tea, aloe, proteins. 

Señora Justina is 63 years old. She is a widow and has 11 children, 7 females and 4 males, all of whom work now. She makes sweet bread. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla, cinnamon and firewood with which to make her sweet bread and pastries (called shells and kisses) and white bread rolls. She started her business 35 years ago and with the savings from the business bought the ingredients. She used to work with her aunt and watched her make the bread and learned how to do the same. The business is important because with it they never lack for food. She makes bread every 8 days. On Thursdays and Sundays her daughters help her make the bread. She goes to town to sell her products as she has customers that date back years and know the days she sells on. She sells her products that gives her the money to buy food for her grandchildren. She uses the profit to pay off debts, reinvest and for food. Her dreams and hopes are to live well, quiet and happy with her family and also wishes the best for her children. The members of the group want to thank Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad: "Thank you for the loans; we are grateful to you. Thanks to your help we can move forwards with our businesses."

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla, cinnamon and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Abril Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Abril, está conformado por la señora Cecilia va a comprar con su préstamo refrescos, azúcar, huevo, aceite, galletas, dulces, la señorita Maribel va a comprar cable, tornillos, productos de limpieza, material eléctrico, la señora Roció va a comprar zapatos para surtir sus pedidos y catálogos de temporada, la señora Delfina va a comprar topper, la señora Margarita va a comprar queso, crema, requesón. La señorita Maribel tiene 27 años de edad, ella es soltera no tiene hijos, ella tiene una ferretería y  tlapalería en el centro de su comunidad ella solicito su préstamo para comprar cable, pvc, clavos, tornillos, material eléctrico y productos de limpieza, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años, ella trabajaba en la capital con sus tíos que tenían su ferretería  y decidió poner su propia ferretería  en su comunidad, su negocio es importante por ser una forma de independizarse y tener su propio negocio, ella está orgullosa de su negocio de que fue el esfuerzo de su trabajo tanto tiempo estuvo trabajando y  ahora tiene su propio negocio, sus clientes son los albañiles, herreros, amas de casa, estudiantes, ella utiliza las ganancia para volver a invertir en mercancía, ella está contenta con este préstamo que va a recibir es una oportunidad de ampliar su negocio, sus sueños y esperanza son formar una familia y ayudarles a sus papas en lo que pueda. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias a ustedes podemos iniciar o mejorar los negocios y que sigan ayudando a mas personas que lo soliciten".
texts.en:
This communal bank group is called Abril. It is made up of: Señora Cecilia who is going to buy soft drinks, sugar, eggs, oil, cookies, sweets with her loan; Señorita Maribel who is going to buy cable, screws, cleaning products, electrical materials; Señora Roció is going to buy shoes to fill her orders and seasonal catalogues; Señora Delfina who is going to buy toppers (men's hats); Señora Margarita is going to buy cheese, cream, cottage cheese. 

Señorita Maribel is 27 years old, single and without children. She has a hardware store in the centre of the community. She is asking for a loan to buy cable, pvc, nails, screws, electrical material and cleaning products. She started the business 2 years ago. She used to work in the capital with her uncles who had a hardware store and decided to set up her own hardware store in her own community. Her business is very important as it a means of independence and having her own business. She is proud of her business which was born of her hard work. She worked for a long time and now she has her own business. Her customers are bricklayers, blacksmiths, housewives, students. She uses the profits to reinvest in merchandise. She is happy with the loan she is going to receive as it is an opportunity to expand her business. Her dreams and hope is to have a family and help her parents any way she can. The members of the group want to say to Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad: "Thanks to you we can start or improve our businesses. Continue helping more people who ask for help."

loans.use: to buy cable, pvc, nails, screws, electrical material and cleaning products.

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly de 24 años, convive con Edgar, su pareja, con quien tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 5 años. Esta joven familia vive en la comunidad nativa de San Pablo en el distrito de Pichanaki. Kelly y Edgar, se dedican a la agricultura con la siembra de plátanos en un lote de 15 por 20 metros; y café en otro terreno de la misma magnitud. La cosecha de los plátanos son cada quince días, por ello, kelly es más constante con sus cuidados. Por su parte el café requiere de mayor inversión en abonos y contrata de personal. Así también trabaja en terrenos ajenos como jornalera, ganando de 20 a 25 soles diariamente. “En los días de cosecha me pagan hasta 30 soles, si me conviene esta actividad”, menciona. Sus inicios, en las siembras fueron precoces, por falta de capital para las compras de abonos y semillas. Ahora sus metas son claras, piensa arrendar otros terrenos y expandir sus sembríos mejorando su producción. De esa manera logrará otorgar a sus menores hijos el sustento adecuado. Es la primera vez que Kelly accedería a un crédito de MFP, se muestra ilusionada por la experiencia de pertenecer a su banco comunal, por eso promete ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas y colaboradora. De concretarse el préstamo, destinará el dinero en la contrata de personal para el cultivo de las plantaciones de plátanos. En al limpieza de la mala yerba específicamente.
texts.en:
Kelly is 24 years old and lives with her partner Edgar. They have three children (ages 8, 6, and 5). This young family lives in the native community of San Pablo in the District of Pichanaki. Kelly and Edgar are farmers who grow bananas on a plot of land that is 15 x 20 meters. They grow coffee on another plot of land that is of the same size. The bananas are harvested every 15 days. For this reason, Kelly must constantly monitor her crops. The coffee requires a great investment of fertilizers and manual labor. Kelly also works on other farms as a laborer and earns between 20 and 25 PEN each day. “On harvest days, I get paid 30 PEN if I choose to work during that time,” she mentions. When she started planting crops, Kelly lacked the capital to buy fertilizers and seeds. Now her goals are clear. She plans to rent other plots of land so that she can expand her plantings and improve her production. Working in this manner will help her to provide adequate sustenance for her young children.

This is the first time Kelly has acquired a loan from MFP. She is excited about being part of her Communal Bank. For this reason, she promises to be punctual with her loan payments and cooperate with the other members. Upon receiving this loan, Kelly will use the money to hire workers to maintain her banana crops. Specifically, they will be charged with removing weeds.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Sanlo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Sanlo   esta integrado por personas artesanas trabajadoras llenas de sueños con ganas de salir a delante  y triunfar en un futuro.
Sus integrantes  decidieron ponerle así por que se caracterizan con su localidad y su cultura ,la mayoría  se dedican a la elaboración de bolsas  y servilletas.

Una de sus integrantes es la señora Leticia  de veinte siete años de edad quien esta felizmente  casada con el señor  Pablo de  veinte ocho años de edad , con quien tiene  tres hijos una mujer de  once años de edad y dos varones  por quien la señora Leticia trabaja ya que desea darle una mejor vida a sus hijos  para que puedan estudiar fuera ya que en su pueblo no  hay  una escuela donde pueda estudiar una licenciatura.

Doña Leticia se dedica a la venta de artesanías como son: bolsas tejidas y servilletas y hipiles , tiene con su negocio aproximadamente diez años lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es bordar ya que desde muy pequeña le gustaba borda , su madre fue quien le ensayo a bordar  y a combinar los colores para que sus servilletas  se vean alegres.

Uno de los sueños de doña Leticia es  tener una escuela de corte y confesión donde pueda ensayar  a las  personas a elaborar ropa ya que es otra de las cosas que mas le gustan y la llenan  de vida.
 
Pidió el préstamo para comprar mas  material para la elaboración de bolsas y servilletas como son: hilos de diferentes colores  , manta blanca y manta de color , agujas  y aros para apretar la tela y gancho para bordar.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha ofrecido para poder cambiar sus vida y brindarle un mejor futuro ya que lo  necesitan para que puedan vivir mejor.
 Gracias fundación par ayudar a las familias padres de comunidades necesitadas.

Las otras integrantes que conforman el grupo son:
Valentina-se dedica a la elaboración de huipiles ,batas , servilletas y manteles.
José M.- se dedica a la elaboración  de  quesos y a la venta de leche.
Antonacia- se dedica a la elaboración de huipiles ,servilletas y batas.
Beatriz- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas, batas y huipiles.
Bufemia- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y batas y huipiles.
Virginia- se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas y manteles.
María - se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
María  Lourdes- se dedica a la elaboración de servilletas y manteles.
María Inés – se dedica a la elaboración de  servilletas y manteles.
 

Gracias fundación por su apoyo y por preocuparse por nosotros  que deseamos  vivir mejor.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Sanlo, and it is made up of a group of craft workers who are full of dreams and desire to progress and succeed in the future. The majority of members make bags and napkins, and they chose their group name as it characterizes their area and culture. 

One of the group's members is 27-year-old Leticia who is happily married to Paul, 28. They have three children - one daughter (age 11) and two sons. Leticia works hard to give her children a better life, so that they can study away from home as there is no college where they could obtain a degree in their town. 

Leticia sells handicrafts such as woven bags, napkins and traditional tunics. She has had this business for about ten years, and what she likes best about it is embroidery, which she has enjoyed since childhood. Leticia's mother taught her how to embroider, and how to combine cheerful colors to make her napkins look attractive.

One of Leticia's dreams is to have a dressmaking school where she can teach people to embroider clothes, which is another of her passions that enriches her life.
 
Leticia has asked for this loan to buy more material for producing bags and napkins, such as colored threads, bleached and colored cotton, needles and rings to tighten the fabric, and embroidery hooks.

She thanks the foundation for the support they have offered to help change her life, provide a better future and enable her family to live better. Thanks to the foundation, families in needy communities have received help.

The other members that make up the group are:

Valentina, who makes traditional tunics, bathrobes, napkins and tablecloths.
Jose M., who makes cheese and sells milk.
Antonacia, who makes traditional tunics, towels and bathrobes
Beatrice, who makes napkins, bathrobes and tunics.
Bufemia, who makes traditional tunics, towels and bathrobes
Virginia, Mary, Maria Lourdes and Mary Agnes, who make napkins and tablecloths.
 

They thank the foundation for the support, and for caring about those who want to make better lives for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase thread, cotton, rings, needles etc., for producing woven bags and napkins

loans.name: Hanny Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Hanny, esta conformado por la señora Dolores va a compra con su prestamo hojas, lapiceros, lapices, libretas, papel bond, la señora Silvestra va a comprar dulces chocolates, paletas, duvalines, la señora Erika va a comprar brassier, pantaletas, camisetas, la señora Atzidi Guadalupe va a comprar bolsas de cosmeticos, donas para el cabello, la señora Virginia va a comprar hierbas, empaques, goteros, pomaderos para elaborar jarabe y pomadas. La señora Dolores tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en las huertas frutales, ellos tiene 3 hijos 2 mujeres y 1 varón, las 2 mujeres estudian la universidad y el varón estudia la secundaria, ella tiene su negocio de venta de papelería, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar lápiz, lapicero, bolsas de regalo, peluches, cajas de regalo y artículos de novedades ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años se lo traspaso su suegra y con la venta lo siguió surtiendo, su negocio es importante por los ingresos que obtiene, a ella le gusta atender a sus clientes y se siente orgullosa cuando los clientes le dicen que encuentra la mayoría de artículos que buscan, su negocio es popular por estar ubicado en el mercado y por el buen trato que les da a sus clientes, las ganancias de su negocio las vuelve a invertir y aprovecha las ganancias de temporada en día de muertos o en navidad, sus sueños y esperanzas son que terminen su carrera sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por sus préstamos, gracias por ayudarnos a realizar los sueños de nuestros negocios.
texts.en:
The Hanny communal bank is comprised of:

Dolores, who will use her loan to buy paper, pencils, notebooks, and bond paper.

Silvestra, who will buy chocolates and milk cream candy.

Erika, who will buy bras, panties, and t-shirts.

Guadalupe, who will buy bags of cosmetics and hair scruncies.

Virginia, who will buy herbs, packaging, droppers, and pomade containers in order to make syrup and pomades. 

Dolores, age 42, is married, and her husband works in the fruit gardens.  They have three children; two girls and a boy.  The girls attend the university, and the boy is in high school.  

She has a business selling stationery items.  She requested her loan to buy pencils, pens, gift bags, stuffed animals, gift boxes, and novelty items.  She started her business six years ago; her mother-in-law sold it to her.  With the sale she continued stocking it.  Her business is important because of the income she gets.

She likes attending to her customers, and she is proud when her customers tell her that they find the majority of items they are looking for.  Her business is popular for being in the market and for the good treatment she gives her customers.  She invests her earnings in the business, and she takes advantage of the income during the Día de Muertos or Christmas seasons.

Her hopes and dreams are for her children to complete their career studies.  

The members of the group thank Kiva and the Fundación Realidad for the loans.  “Thanks for helping us fulfill our dreams for out businesses.”

loans.use: to buy pencils, pens, gift bags, stuffed animals, gift boxes, and novelty items, etc.

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Orfelinda de 23 años, convive con Melgildo, su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shaoriato en el distrito de Pichanaki. Orfelinda y su pareja han visto en la agricultura el sustento y la oportunidad para su desarrollo. La rutina en el campo es cansada pero libre y sin horarios exigidos. “Con este trabajo puedo distribuir mi tiempo para cocinar, atender mi casa y cuidar mis hijos, me siento bien con lo que hago”, comenta. En los terrenos de su propiedad tiene cultivada plantas de café, cuyos frutos estarán listos para el mes de mayo y junio. Así también tiene sembrada una hectárea de kión, producto que ya está comercializando en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Cuando las tareas del campo cesan, Melgildo trabaja como operario en parcelas ajenas. Esta madre y esposa laboriosa anhela comprarse artefactos, electrodomésticos y algunos muebles para implementar su hogar. Con el pasar de los años concretará este deseo. Éste sería el primer préstamo que obtendrá de MFP. Se compromete a ser cumplidor en el pago de las cuotas señaladas. “San Pablo Shima”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de ser parte de él.
Invertirá el dinero en el pago de jornaleros a quienes contratará para la limpieza de sus kiones. Gastará 25 soles al día por peón. Con lo restante comprará abonos para el café.
texts.en:
Orfelinda, 23 years old, lives with her spouse Melgildo,  and they have 2 children, 8 and 5 years of age.  This family lives in their own house in the San Pablo de Shaoriato community of the Pichanaki district.  Orfelinda and her spouse have seen in farming the opportunity to support themselves and develop.  The routine in the fields is tiring but feels free without fixed time schedules.  "With this work I can allocate my time to cooking, taking care of the house and caring for my children.  I feel good with what I do" she comments.  In her fields she has planted coffee which will be ready to harvest in May or June.  She also planted a hectare of ginger, a product that she is already selling in the city of Pichanaki.  When the field work slows, Melgido works as an operator in other fields.  This hard working mother and wife wishes to buy electrical appliances and some furniture to furnish her home.  As time goes on she will realize these wishes.  This is the first loan with MFP.  She promises to comply with the assigned payments.  “San Pablo Shima” is the name of her community bank and she feels proud to be a member.  
She will invest the loan money in the payment to laborers that she will hire to clean the ginger fields.  It will cost her 25 soles per day for each worker.  With the rest of the money she will buy fertilizer for the coffee trees.

loans.use: to contract laborers and buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Baudilio Salomon

texts.es:
Don Baudilio tiene 47 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 4 hijos, su actividad principal es el cultivo de café, tiene una experiencia bastante amplia, nos manifestó que desde que era niño fue el trabajo que le enseño su padre y ahora es a lo que él se dedica. 
Don Baudilio utilizara el credito para comprar un panel de energia solar e iluminar su casa por las noches,  es lo que siempre ha deseado, nunca han gozado del servicio de energía eléctrica y le seria de gran beneficio a su familia, además de tener luz, podrán cargar sus celulares y en el futuro comprarse un Televisor para ver con su familia algunos programas de entretenimiento, noticias y partidos de futbol.
texts.en:
Don Baudilio is 47 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. His main business activity is growing coffee. He has ample experience and says that he has been working since he was a boy. His father taught him this trade and now it is his line of work.

Don Baudilio will use this loan to buy a solar panel system so that he can provide light for his home in the evenings. This is what he always wanted because he never enjoyed having electricity and now his family will experience this great benefit. In addition to having light, Baudilio will be able to charge his mobile phone. In the future, he wants to buy a television so that his family can watch entertainment programs, the news, and soccer matches.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system.

loans.name: Tereza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Tereza , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , juntos a sus dos hijas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar su condiciones de vida ,ella está muy contenta por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos kiva  ya que con el primer crédito logro realizar un muro de la vivienda lo cual ahora goza de mas privacidad , ahora ella quiere que se le facilite un desembolso para la compra de cerámica y zinc para mejorar las condiciones de vivienda , ya que ella no cuenta con el salario suficiente para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción de una sola vez .
texts.en: Tereza lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with her two daughters.  The plan she has for her family is to improve their standard of living.  She is very happy for the support Afodenic has provided by means of the Kiva loans since, with her first loan, she managed to build a wall around her house that has afforded her more privacy.  Currently, she wants to access loan funds to buy ceramic and zinc to make further improvements to her house since she does not have the income necessary to buy construction materials all at once.

loans.use: buy ceramic and zinc.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un hombre laborioso, a sus 52 años de edad ha visto a sus 5 hijos crecer y tener sus propias familias. Se separó de su esposa y ahora vive solo en su casa propia en el centro poblado Las Palmas Ipoki en el distrito de Pichanaki. Gracias al clima y a los suelos fértiles de su localidad, siembra kión y café. Pero su prioridad son los kiones con 3 parcelas enteras de este producto. “En esta zona, los kiones crecen grandes y se venden bien en la ciudad de Pichanaki”, comenta. A su vez, cuenta con 1 lote de 20 por 15 metros cuadrados en los que sembró café.  Menciona que, el café también es rentable, pero necesita más cuidados y mayor inversión. Por esa razón empezará una nueva siembra de este, internacionalmente exigido, fruto.
Para tal proceso, trabaja con personal operario a quien paga al día o por contrato.
Andrés espera continuar con la faena en el campo, ampliando sus cosechas de kión e incursionando en la producción de café en mayor escala. De esa manera podrá adquirir algunos muebles para su rústico hogar y así brindarse una ancianidad segura y una calidad de vida más cómoda. Impulsado por recomendaciones de amigos, Andrés desea trabajar con MFP, sería su primer préstamo. Por esa razón promete ser preciso en el pago de sus cuotas. Está emocionado por iniciarse dentro de “San Pablo de Shima”, su banco comunal.
De obtener el dinero del crédito, podrá comprar abonos para los sembríos de kión y café, así como pagar la mano de obra de operarios.
texts.en:
Andrés is a hard-working man.  At 52 years of age, he has seen his 5 children grow up and start their own families.  Andrés is separated from his wife and  now lives alone in his own home which is located in the village of Las Palmas Ipoki, in Pichanaki district.  Thanks to the climate and the fertile soils of his area, he is able to grow ginger and coffee.  However, his priority is the ginger, which he grows on 3 whole plots.  "In this region, ginger grows well and it sells well in the city of Pichanaki", he comments.  He mentions that coffee is profitable too but it needs more care and more investment.  He will start sowing a new lot of this product which is in demand internationally.  To do this he works with staff who he pays by the day or by contract.

Andrés hopes to continue with his farm work, expanding his ginger harvests and starting to produce coffee on a larger scale.  In this way, he will be able to buy some items of furniture for his basic house and thereby provide himself with a secure old age and a more comfortable quality of life.  Driven by recommendations from friends, Andrés would like to work with MFP.  This will be his first loan and he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  He is excited to be starting work with 'San Pablo de Shima', his community bank.  With the loan money, he will be able to buy manure for his ginger and coffee crops and to pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure and to hire laborers

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
La señora Rosalina tiene 34 años de edad y está casada con el señor Gerardo, con quien tiene 3 hijos, Omar, Beatriz y José Luis de los cuales todos estudian, 2 están cursando quinto y sexto año de primaria y el mas pequeño esta en tercer año de preescolar, se dedica a la venta de maíz y refrescos, desde hace mas de 6 años.
Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio, buscando la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida, también para mejorar un poco mas su solvencia económica y así asegurar el futuro y educación de sus hijos, el crédito que recibió decidió invertirlo en la compra de mas maíz y refrescos, para continuar con sus ventas  
El deseo más grande que tiene doña Rosa (como mejor la conocen sus vecinos) para su negocio, es la de incrementar su inversión, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quisiera poner un deposito de refrescos, para así mejorar e incrementar aún más sus ganancias, y continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y puedan tener una muy buena profesión.
Esta muy satisfecha por contar con el apoyo de FRAC y los donadores de kiva, ya que gracias a esto ahora goza de una mejor producción y surtido en el negocio, que le ayuda, para continuar ahorrando parte de sus ganancias, puesto que así asegurara la educación superior de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalinda is 34 years old and is married to Mr. Gerardo, together they have 3 children: Omar, Beatriz and Jose Luis, who are all in school.  Two are in the 5th and 6th grades of elementary school and the youngest is in the third year of preschool.  For the last 6 years, she has been making a living selling corn and beverages.
She decided to start this business as she was looking for a way to help her husband with the household expenses and provide a better quality of life.  It also helps to improve their financial position and assure the future and education of the children.  The loan received is to purchase corn and beverages to be able to continue selling them.
The greatest wish that Doña Rosa (as she is known by her neighbors) has for her business is that the increase in investment will produce rapid growth.  She would like to get a tank of beverages to improve and increase her sales and profits and continue to support her children in their studies hoping that they will have a good profession when they grow up.
She is very satisfied with the support from FRAC and the donations from Kiva, since due to these she enjoys improvements in the output and stock of her business.  This helps her to continue saving a portion of her income towards the advanced education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth cuenta con 44 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella junto con sus hijos tienen una blockera (se dedican a la elaboración de blocks), desde hacen 6 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar de manera de apoyar a su familia y mejorar aun mas su calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas material como: cemento y arena, para continuar con las ventas en su negocio.
La meta que tiene doña eli (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio y espera poder cumplirla, es la de invertirle muchísimo más, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere comprar mas utensilios de trabajo palas, marcas y 3 carretillas, para así mejorar e incrementar un poco mas sus producción e ingresos, puesto que así podrá asegurar su futuro.
Le da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por la confianza que les ha brindando, ya que gracias a ese apoyo ahora puede continuar con la inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old, widowed and has four children who are all now married.  She and her children own a brick factory (they manufacture concrete blocks); they’ve had it for six years.

She says that she decided to go into this activity because she wanted to find a way to support her family and improve their quality of life still more.  The loan she got will be used to buy more raw materials like cement and sand to continue with sales.

Eli’s (as she’s better known in her community) goal for her business that she hopes to reach is to invest much more into it to make it grow quickly because she wants to buy more work tools: shovels, templates and three wheelbarrows to improve and increase production and income a bit more because then she’d be able to insure her future.

She thanks Kiva lenders for the trust they’ve placed in her because thanks to this support she’s able now to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like cement and sand.

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Agustina cuenta con 44 años de edad, está casada su esposo se llama Manuel quien es campesino, tienen 4 hijos víctor, estela, Joaquín y marina de los cuales todos estudian, el mayor esta cursando el segundo año de prepa, uno mas está en segundo año de secundaria y los dos mas pequeños en quinto y sexto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de manteles y servilletas, desde hacen 4 años.
Doña Maria dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con la educación de sus hijos, también para tener una mejor solvencia económica, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: hilos, agujas, manta, tela y cuadrille, para continuar con sus ventas.
Ella tiene una meta para su negocio, dice que desea hacerlo crecer muchísimo, ya que quiere poner su taller de costura, para enseñarle a mas personas a elaborar estas artesanías y tenerla mejor surtida, para así contar con mejores ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con los donadores de kiva y FRAC, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que gracias a esta ayuda ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Agustina is 44. She is married to Manuel, a farmer. They have four children: Victor, Estela, Joaquin and Marina, who are all in school. The eldest is in the second year of preparatory school, the second-eldest is in the second year of high school, and the youngest two are in the fifth and sixth years of elementary school. Maria has made and sold blankets and napkins for four years.
Mrs. Maria says that she decided to start this work because she wanted to find a way to support her husband with the household costs and with their children's education, as well as to have greater financial solvency. She will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise, such as: threads, needles, blankets, fabric and cross-stitch fabric in order to continue selling.
She has a goal for her business. She says that she wants to expand it greatly, since she wants to open a sewing workshop to teach people to make these crafts and have more stock. This will give her a greater income.
She is very grateful to the Kiva and FRAC lenders, and for all the support and confidence that we are offering. Thanks to this help, she can now continue investing in her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as: threads, needles, blankets, fabric and cross-stitch fabric.

loans.name: Jose Concepcion

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años de edad, esta soltero y su actividad es la caficultura, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia en el manejo del cafe, siendo esta actividad la fuente principal de ingresos que percibe anualmente.
José utilizara el credito para comprar un panel de energia solar y poder iluminar su casa en la que pronto  formara su familia, toda su vida no ha gozado del servicio de energía eléctrica y él desea tener su casa iluminada y ya no seguir usando los candiles y velas, que son dañinos para la salud y el medio ambiente.
texts.en:
José is 34, single, and cultivates coffee. He has four years' experience in this line of work, and this is his main source of annual income.
José will use this loan to purchase a solar panel so that he can light the home in which he will soon start a family. In his entire life, he has never had electric power. He would like to have light in his home so that he can stop using oil lamps and candles; these are harmful for human health and for the environment.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Carolina Aida

texts.es:
La señora carolina Aída tiene 48 años de edad y está casada con el señor florentino quien es campesino, con el cual tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo miguel estudia, está cursando el tercer año de preparatoria, ya que los otros 2 están casados, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con la cual lleva mas de 25 años 
Dice que decidió invertir en esta actividad, porque quiere ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ya que trabajaba demasiado en el campo y no gana lo suficiente para tener una buena solvencia económica, también para continuar apoyando a su hijo con sus estudios, y pueda tener una muy buena carrera profesional, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: refrescos, leche, huevos, aceite, sal, crema, agua, arroz, etc. Para tener un poca mas surtido su negocio.
Una de las metas que tiene doña ofe (como la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio, es la de hacerla crecer muchísimo, ya que está pensando en mas a delante construir un local, para poner su comedor, comprar sillas y mesas y tener una mejor producción, ya que así mejorara e incrementara mucho mas sus ingresos.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad y a los prestatarios de kiva, por todo el apoyo y confianza que le están brindando, ya que esto le servirá de mucho, puesto que ahora puede continuar invirtiendo en su negocio y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina Aída is 48 and married to Mr. Florentino, a farmer. They have three children: Miguel is in his third year of preparatory school, and the other two are married. Carolina has a grocery store, which she has run for over 25 years. She says that she decided to invest in this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household costs, since he works too much in the fields and does not make enough for them to have good economic solvency. She also wanted to continue supporting her son in his studies so that he can have a good professional career. Carolina will invest this loan in the purchase of more merchandise such as: pop, milk, eggs, oil, salt, cream, water, and rice. This will allow her to have more stock.
As one of her goals for her business, Mrs. Ofe (as she is known in the community) wants to see it grow. She is thinking about building a restaurant in the future, and buying tables and chairs and making food. This way she will increase her income.
She thanks Fundacion Realidad and the Kiva lenders for all of our support and confidence in her. This loan will be very helpful for her, since she can now continue to invest in her business and support her family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of more merchandise such as: pop, milk, eggs, oil, salt, cream, water, rice.

loans.name: Carmen's Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen es casada, tiene 35 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a actividades pecuarias, a la c4rianza D. cerdos, inició su actividad económica, sembrando hortalizas y la crianza D. gallina ponedoras, hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizaran para  la compra D. cerdos, en el futuro quiere contar con una granja. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la crianza D. ganado, crianza D. cerdos y crianza D. gallina.
texts.en: Carmen, 35, is married.  She never had the opportunity to go to school.  She has five children one of which is going to school.  She’s in animal husbandry; she raises pigs.  She started her economic activity growing vegetables and raising brooding hens.  To date, she has 10 years’ experience. She organizes a group to request a loan that will be used to buy pigs.  In the futures she’s like to have a farm.  The other group members raise cattle, pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Elvin Roney

texts.es: El Joven Elvin Roney tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de un hijo, su actividad principal es el cultivo del cafe, tiene 5 años de experiencia en el manejo del cafe y gracias a esta actividad productiva ha salido adelante construyendo su propia vivienda, Elvin tiene muchos deseos de superación, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un panel de energia solar, en su comunidad no se cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y ahora que tiene su propia vivienda desea de este servicio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Elvin Roney, 25, lives in a common law relationship and is the father of a son.  His main activity is growing coffee.  He has five years’ experience growing coffee and thanks to this activity he’s gotten ahead and has built his own house.  Elvin very much wants to get ahead and will use the loan to buy a solar energy panel.  His community does not have electricity and now that he has a house of his own he wants to have this service to improve his living conditions and his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy panel.

loans.name: Erick Alexander

texts.es:
Erick Alexander   vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business

Erick es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, él  trabaja en el servicio de transporte urbano haciendo taxi en su moto.
Él es un hombre perseverante y muy responsable con muchas ganas de salir cada día adelante. 
Erick empezó su negocio en el año 2008 en el servicio de transporte, por lo que es mas rentable y económico, ganando semanalmente S/.250 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y 6 días a la semana. No ha tenido créditos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000 que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Erick invertirá su crédito para la compra de su propia moto y así tener mayores ingresos y poder así ayudar a sus padres que son de avanzada edad. También su crédito permitirá a Erick a desarrollarse en el futuro, él sueña con tener su propia casa y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres. Su asesor de crédito cree que es excelente cliente y puede pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Erick Alexander lives and works in Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
Erick is a single 29-year-old man who offers an urban transportation service; he provides a taxi service on his motorcycle.
He is a persevering and very responsible man with a great desire to get ahead every day.
Erick started his business in 2008. Transportation is more profitable and economical. He makes 250 nuevos soles per week. He works about ten hours every day, six days a week. He has never taken out a loan. With this loan of 1000 soles, which he will receive thanks to Kiva, Erick will invest in buying his own mototaxi in order to make a better income and to be able to help his aging parents. This loan will also allow Erick to develop himself in the future. He dreams of having his own home and offering his parents a better quality of life.
His credit assessor believes that he is an excellent client and will be able to repay his quotas punctually.

loans.use: to purchase his own mototaxi.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesus

texts.es:
Don Nelson tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre, sus hijos ya formaron nuevas familias, Nelson y su compañera de hogar han quedado solos nuevamente, Nelson se dedica al cultivo de café, tiene una experiencia bastante amplia, manifestó que desde que era niño fue el trabajo que le enseño su padre y ahora es a lo que él se dedica. 
Don Nelson utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar y asi iluminar su casa por las noches que es lo que siempre a deseado, nunca han gozado del servicio de energía eléctrica y toda su vida se han alumbrado con candiles y velas, perjudicando así su salud y el medio ambiente.
gracias a este panel de energia solar su calidad de vida sera diferente.
texts.en: Nelson is 44 years old and lives with common-law wife. His children have already formed their own families, leaving Nelson and his partner to live alone. Nelson makes a living cultivating coffee. His has a good depth of experience and says that since he was a boy his father taught him the work, and now he has dedicated himself to the trade. Nelson plans to use the loan to purchase a solar panel so he can light his house at nights. It's what he has always wanted. He has never had electrical service and has been lighting fires and candles all his life, harming his health and the environment. Thanks to the solar panel his quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Santos Roman

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado y de su matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo, Santos se dedica al cultivo del cafe, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el manejo del cafe, esta actividad le genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
Don Santos utilizara el credito para la campra de una planta de energia solar, en donde el vive no cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica y las posibilidades de que puedan gozar de este servicio son bien remotas, toda sus vida se a iluminado con candiles y velas, mismas que son dañinas para la salud y el medio ambiente, Santos siempre a soñado tener luz propia en su casa y gracias a este sistema de energia solar su sueño se hara realidad.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 48 years old, married and has only one dependent child. Santos grows coffee and has more than 10 years experience handling coffee. This business generates an income to cover his household expenses. 
 
Don Santos will use the loan to buy a solar energy plant as where he lives there is no electrical power services and the chances of accessing these services are remote. He has used candles and oil lamps as a source of light his entire life which are harmful both for your health and the environment. Santos has always dreamed of having his own light in his house and thanks to this system of solar energy his dream will become reality.

loans.use: to buy a solar power panel.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos que son mayores de edad, son independientes, ella se dedico parte de su vida a dar clases en las escuelas primarias fue con esta profesión que logro criar  a sus dos hijos, pero el salario era muy bajo entonces decidió poner su propio negocio para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar, comenzó vendiendo oro después puso una mini tienda de ropa y así poco a poco ha venido levantando su negocio surtiéndolo de nuevos productos para  vender, es por ello que requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas tales como manzana, uvas, peras , mandarinas ya que se acerca la temporada en el que este tipo de frutas son muy buscadas por los clientes y no quiere perder la oportunidad de dejar de vender. 
Ella es siempre busca la manera de surgir en la vida, nos expresa que una de sus expectativas es poner una pulpería con bastantes productos para ofrecer, debido a que hay pocas pulperías en la zona donde ella vive.
texts.en: María is 55 years old and lives in the city of Estelí,. She is a single mother who has 2 children who are both adult and independent. She has spent part of her life teaching primary school and doing this she managed to raise her 2 children. However, the salary was very low and so she decided to set up her own business to help her with the household expenses. She started off selling gold and then set up a ministore selling clothes and thus litlle by little she has grown her business stocking new products to sell. This is why she wants the loan to buy fruit such as apples, grapes, pears and mandarin oranges as the season is approaching when these fruits are much sought after by customers and she doesn't want to miss the opportunity to make sales. She is always looking for ways to succeed in life. She tells us that one of her expectations is to set up a grocery store with enough products to offer, as there are few grocery stores in the area where she lives.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, grapes, pears, mandarin oranges.

loans.name: Pasuc Group

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala Confesora es casada, tiene 52 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 8 hijos 1 D. los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica a la crianza D. animales doméstiC., específicamente a la crianza D. cerdos, inició criando gallina ponedoras ya hasta el momento lleva 10 años D. experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para compra D. cerdos, alimentación y vacunas para mantenerlos en buenas salud, en el futuro espera contar con una graja. Los demás integrantes se dedica a la confección D. prendas, crianza D. animales.
texts.en:
Sra. Pascuala Confesora is 52 years old, married, and did not have the opportunity to study. She has eight children, one of whom is in school. Pascuala raises domesticated animals, specifically pigs. She started out raising egg-laying hens and now has 10 years of experience.

Pascuala organized a group so that she could request a loan. She plans to buy pigs, feed, and vaccines so that she can keep her animals in good health. In the future, she hopes to have a farm.

The other members have businesses that involve making clothes and raising animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrated feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: San Luis De Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Luís de Cumbe, está conformado por 8 socias y un socio, quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, esta parroquia es de clima frió y su gente es de un corazón muy cálido, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, esta parroquia se caracteriza por la estructura de sus casas que están construidas de adobe y teja, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos trabajan en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Etelvina, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  al cual fue  invitada por una vecina.
 
La socia tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 25, 21, 9, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes y tres hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que habita es propia construida con el trabajo y sacrificio conyugal.
 
Doña Rosa Etelvina se dedica a cuidado de su casa y cómo pasa el mayor tiempo en ella cría y venta de  ganado, cuyes y gallinas. También se dedica la agricultura y lo que produce es solo para el consumo de su hogar.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para la cría.
 
Su meta es terminar de construir su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunos acabados.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de tres integrantes de este grupo que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “San Luís de Cumbe” consists of eight women and one man who live on the outskirts of Cumbe parish in the city of Cuenca. This parish experiences cold weather. The people are extremely warm-hearted and have maintained the culture and traditions of their ancestors. This parish is known for the structure of its houses, which are made of adobe and tiles. The people engage in livestock breeding and agriculture. Many of them work in the city in various activities.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Rosa Etelvina. This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after receiving an invitation from a neighbor. She is 43 years old, married, and has six children (ages 25, 21, 9, 7, 5, and 3). Her first two children are married and live independently. Three of her children attend a school in the city. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. They own the house in which they live, which was built as a result of her husband’s work and sacrifice.

Doña Rosa Etelvina takes care of the household and also spends most of her time raising and selling cattle, guinea pigs, and chickens. She also grows crops, but what she produces is only for household consumption. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs to raise. Her goal is to complete the construction of her house, which is lacking a few finishing touches.

The smaller attached photo is of three members of the group who were not present when the main group photo was taken because they had to work.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.en:
The Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank was formed two years ago in the small village of San Francisco Chuatuj, which is located in the western highlands of Guatemala. The Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank has 13 hard-working women members and is in its third loan cycle as a group. The Trust Bank repaid its two previous loans with Friendship Bridge in full and on time.  

Mary Leocadia, named after her grandmother, is the president of the Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank. For the past three years, she has raised livestock, whiC. she then sells in the market that is located 3km away from her town. A single mother of three boys (ages 8, 6 and 1), Mary plans to use her current loan to buy additional livestock so that she can increase her sales and continue to grow her business. She uses her income to support her family and pay for her two oldest boys' education.  Her dream is to continue to build her livestock business. She also hopes to go back to school since she only has an eighth-grade education. Mary, like the other 12 women in the Mujeres Valientes Trust Bank, is thankful to have access to capital through Friendship Bridge and Kiva. In her words, she "hopes that each Kiva lender receives all of the blessings you deserve."

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils such as pots, cutlery, plates, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy egg-laying hens.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is from the village of Ozamis City. She is 43 years old. Lilia is married with five children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as shampoos, candies, diapers, etc in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

Lilia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Lilia is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La  Señora Adelina, tiene 63 años de edad, es madre soltera por viudez, tiene 6 hijos, ella reside en  una comunidad urbana del Municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara.
Vive en compañía de 3 de sus hijos, los otros 3 están casados. Su negocio consiste en una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios.
Ella inicio su negocio con un crédito que le proporcionó ODEF y desde entonces ha sido cliente permanente. En el pasado ella se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas, pero con la necesidad de obtener mayores ingresos decidió cambiar su actividad económica.
Doña Adelina ha solicitado un préstamo para surtir su pulpería con productos como granos básicos (maíz, arroz, frijoles), golosinas, huevos, detergentes y jabones.
Considera que sus ingresos han mejorado, la cuota que debe pagar de su prestamo esta acorde con las ventas y utilidades que recibe.  Sus planes son aumentar las ventas y mantener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Adelina, age 63, is a single mother because she is a widow.  She has six children.  She lives in an urban community in the Quimistan municipality, Santa Bárbara.  She lives with three of her children; the other three are married. 

Her business is a grocery store where she sells food products.  She started her business with a loan from ODEF.  Since then she has been a permanent client.  She used to sell tortillas, but she needed more income.  She decided to change her business activity.

Adelina has requested a loan to stock her grocery store with products like basic grains (corn, rice, beans), sweets, eggs, detergents, and soaps.  She believes that her income has improved.

The loan payments that she needs to make are in accordance with the sales and profits that she receives.

Her plans are to increase sales and to keep her business stocked.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, trousers, blouses, and clothing.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Dina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Dina has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Dina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blenders, irons, electric fans, clothing, shoes, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is 19 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 

Manilyn has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles, shampoo and detergents. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, shampoo and soaps.

Manilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Manilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, shampoo and soaps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the service of her motorcycle

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, ciudad de  clima cálido y agradable y con una rica gastronomía, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Santo Rosario.

En este lugar vive don Luis, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad, el mismo que estudia en escuela. La esposa es ama de casa.
 
El se dedica al comercio, vende medicinas naturales y ropa de todo tipo, él se desplaza hasta otras ciudades para realizar sus ventas y estas las realiza recorriendo estas ciudades, trabaja tres a cuatro días a la semana, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 7 años dedicado a este negocio y que le va muy bien ya que con esto ha sacado adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar más medicinas naturales y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco  Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy agradables y organizadas.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas y visitar a los clientes.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Santo Rosario” meet every 15 days in Andrés De Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees". This city has a warm and pleasant climate, and is known for its rich cuisine.

Don Luis lives in this place. He is 50 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has a nine-year-old son who is in school. His wife is a homemaker.

Luis is a merchant who sells natural medicines and all types of clothing. He travels to other cities in order to conduct his sales. Luis works three or four days each week. He extends credit and collects payment on a weekly basis. Luis has been in this business for seven years and has done very well, which has enabled his family to move forward.

This loan will be used to buy more natural medicines and clothes of all types. He has participated in two loan cycles with the Communal Bank and enjoys being a member because the other people in his group are very nice and organized.

His dream is to have a car that he can use for conducting his sales and visiting his customers.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dulzora

texts.en:
Dulzora is 65 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 11 children.
 
Dulzora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, detergents, noodles and shampoo. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and shampoo.

Dulzora has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Dulzora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and shampoo

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Evangeline has a shop that sells green bananas and coconuts. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

Evangeline has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Evangeline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell

loans.name: Iliana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, ciudad de  clima cálido y agradable y con una rica gastronomía, cada quince días se reúnen  las socias del Banco Comunal Santo Rosario.

En este lugar vive la señora Iliana, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 13, 11 y 4 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio, escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. El marido es maestro constructor.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y de productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días en las mañanas ya que sus hijos están en sus respectivos centros de estudio, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana. Tiene un año y medio que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa en general. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Santo Rosario” meet every 15 days in Andrés De Vera parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. For many years, Portoviejo has been known as the "City of the Royal Tamarind Trees". This city has a warm and pleasant climate, and is known for its rich cuisine.

Sra. Iliana lives in this place. She is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 13, 11, and 4). The children attend high school, elementary school, and pre-school respectively. Her husband is a master builder.

Iliana is a homemaker. In order to generate her own income and cover the needs of her children, she sells clothing through catalogs and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Iliana works every day in the mornings while her children are at school. She offers her products on credit and collects payment at the end of the week. Iliana has been in business for 1½ years and has done very well. Perfumes are what she sells most.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing. This is her fifth loan cycle with the Communal Bank. She enjoys being a member because the loans have helped to establish her business. Her dream is own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, a 52-year-old married mother of four, is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City, where she has been operating a specialized retail store selling a variety of food products for the past 15 years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dolores joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her second loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase more products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets, duvets and clothes.

loans.name: María Filerma

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, ciudad de  clima cálido y agradable y con una rica gastronomía, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Santo Rosario.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 56 años de edad, hace 12 años su querido esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella ya que es discapacitado.
 
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora que para obtener sus propios ingresos se dedica a la venta de bocadillos, bebidas naturales y gaseosas, tiene un local en su casa en el cual todos los días en las tardes se dedica a vender, trabaja sola y lleva más de seis años con su negocio el cual le permite ganar para sus sustento diario y además se entretiene y se olvida de sus problemas. 
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar sodas, energizantes, aguas y bocadillos de picar. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque se entretiene en las reuniones con sus compañeras. 
 
Su sueño es que su hijo se recupere y vuelva a caminar.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Santo Rosario meets every 15 days in the parish of Andrés De Vera in the city of Portoviejo, capital of  Manabí , a city known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, a city of temperate and agreable climate and great food.

Here we met Señora María who is 56 years old. Twelve years ago her husband died and left her a widow with 2 children. Both are now adults although one of them still lives with her as he is disabled.

She is a very determined woman who to make her own income sells snacks, non-carbonated drinks and soft drinks. She has a store in her own house where she sells every day in the afternoon. She works alone and has been in business for more than 6 years which gives her an income to cover her daily expenses and in addition keeps her busy so that she forgets her problems.

She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, energy drinks, water and snacks. She has been a member of the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because meeting with colleagues is entertaining.

Her dream is that her child recover and walk again.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, energy drinks, water and snacks.

loans.name: Nenencia

texts.en:
Nenencia, a 49-year-old married mother of three grown children, is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City where for over 30 years she has been making and selling ice cream in the local community. She earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nenencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a container for her ice cream cart. This will be her sixth loan taken out from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a container for her ice cream cart.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Emilson Alexander

texts.es:
Emilson, tiene 33 años de edad, casado desde hace 10 años, su esposa trabaja en una maquiladora como operaria, vive en La Lima Cortes, tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, quienes están estudiando.

Emilson tiene un microbús desde hace 8 años, con el cual presta el servicio de transporte escolar, traslada niños a la escuela y colegios, este negocio lo tiene debido a que sus hijos tenían dificultad de transporte para ir a la escuela, entonces decidió hacerlo y tiene sus clientes fijos.
El préstamo lo va a invertir en reparar su microbús, le cambiará el motor para que no le siga fallando y dar un mejor servicio.  De este negocio obtiene los ingresos necesarios para el hogar y estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emilson, age 33, has been married for ten years.  His wife works in a factory as a laborer.  He lives in La Lima Cortes.  They have two children; ages eight and nine.  The children go to school.

Emilson has had a mini-bus for eight years.  He uses to bus to provide school transportation.  He transports children to elementary schools and high schools. He has this business because his children had trouble finding transportation to go to school.  He then decided to provide the transportation, and he has fixed customers.

He will use the loan to repair his mini-bus.  He will change the motor so that it does not continue to break down.  Then he will provide better service.  He gets the income he needs for the household and his children’s education from this business.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his school mini-bus.
