loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 42 years old, married, and has five adult children. Lucila is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. Lucila operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has earned 6,000 PHP a month for more than five years. 

In 2010, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucila has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Lucila is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase motorcycle spare parts and maintenance. This will be Lucila's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
With the last loan, Ni Kadek managed to get a profit of 200,000 Rupiah (IDR) per month. That gain was very helpful to the family's finances as they are currently experiencing difficult times due to the increasing expenses of the necessities of life. 

Ni Kadek and the Sombang Lestari group decided to continue borrowing from MUK since it is especially helpful in developing their piggery businesses. This loan will be used to buy two piglets and pig feed. She hopes this business can support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two piglets for fattening and pig feed.

loans.name: Comercita

texts.en: Comercita, a 41-year-old married mother of six children, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2010, she is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Comercita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en: Batjargal is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and his two sons are school students. He started his car parts retail business in 2001 by renting a container in a market. He started his business by selling oil. Now he sells a wide variety of car parts; however, he is lacking Korean car parts, which are the most in-demand car parts. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy Korean car parts. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says. "Now that Korean cars are increasing, parts demand is high. If I don't sell Korean parts, I might lose my business."

loans.use: To buy Korean car parts

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Margie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 37 years old, married, and has two adult children. Merlyn is from Bacolod, Ozamis City. Merlyn has been in business for two years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Merlyn joind GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 22,791.84 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be Merlyn's tenth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en: Enhjargal is 48 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in house and fence in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business and her daughter is a college student. She started her meat retailing business in 1998 by renting a counter in a market. Since then, she has bought a house and is paying her daughter's college tuition. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to stock up on some supplies before prices get high, which they usually do. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy more meat.

loans.use: To buy more meat.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Sally has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages .

Sally has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future Sally hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Juan Ruperto

texts.es:
El Señor Juan, tiene 64 años de edad, es casado desde hace 30 años, tiene 3 hijos, reside en la comunidad rural de Bella Vista del Municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara.
Vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 3 hijos, su hijo menor esta estudiando la educación primaria. Don Juan se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura, produciendo granos básicos y hortalizas.
Él ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de insumos como fertilizantes y pesticidas para brindarle un mejor manejo a sus cultivos y mejorar la calidad de la cosecha de maíz y frijoles.
Don Juan espera aumentar sus ingresos al mejorar  su producción y vender a un buen precio sus productos.
texts.en:
Juan, 64, has been married for 30 years; he has three children and lives in the community of Bella Vista in San Marcos Municipality, Santa Bárbara, with his wife and three children.  His youngest son is going to elementary school.  Juan has been a farmer his entire life growing basic grains and vegetables.

He has requested a loan to buy supplies like fertilizer and pesticide to provide better crop care and improve his corn and bean harvests.  Juan expects to increase his income when production improves and he sells his products at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Melchora provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy materials needed to provide those services.

Melchora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Melchora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. His wife babysits their newborn baby and the other two children are students. He started his taxi service business earlier this year by using his own car. He also does carpentry part-time. He is a quite talented carpenter, however the carpentry business is very competitive and requires some serious tools, so he decided to start the taxi service. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "It is better to run a taxi because it is less stressful and more profitable." He is requesting 800,000 MNT to maintain his car for the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.use: to maintain his car for the harsh Mongolian winter

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is from the village of Benito Soliven, in the province of Isabela. He is 33 years old. Marcelo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelo owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While it is not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income from the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Marcelo has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest season.

Marcelo is requesting a new loan of PHP 30,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Winelda

texts.en:
Winelda is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Winelda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Winelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Winelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Battulga is 31 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. His wife is a chef in a small cafe, and his daughter goes to kindergarten. He started his taxi service business in 2007 using his own car. A few months ago, his engine broke and his business stopped. Now that his family's financial situation is getting worse, he is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car. He is a hard-working and diligent man who says, "It has been hard since my car broke, I have to do everything I can to make this right."

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum is a 46-year-old married woman, the loving mother of nine children, and is in the business of growing vegetables for sale. She works on her own farmland that is next to her house, earning approximately $2.00 per day. This income cannot support the family well. Two of her sons also work hard to support the family, especially their small brothers and sisters who are school aged. Sum feels pity for her two sons who always go to work by taking a motor taxi and sometimes by walking. It’s really difficult for them and they have to spend much money as well. Therefore, Sum decided to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva in the sums of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her sons for travelling to work. In the future, she wishes to send some of her children to join the university.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her sons for travelling to work.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Glenda has a shop that sells canned foods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Glenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Glenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Burmaa

texts.en: Burmaa is 20 years old and lives with her father and sister in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her father and sister help with her business. She started her business in 2009 by helping her father until earlier this year when she rented her own counter. Her business is going well since her family is very supportive. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to stock up on some supplies before prices get high, which they usually do. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 250,000 MNT to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 61-year-old widow with two adult children. Rosalia is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City.

Rosalia owns and operates a business venture baking and selling a variety of goods including banana cue in the local community. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosalia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Remedios has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Remedios hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Yuthy

texts.en:
Yuthy, who is 36 years old, is married and lives with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorian sites. She sells food, and her husband is a tailor. They work very hard every day to generate income to help cover the family's expenses. 

Yuthy is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more food to resell to her new and existing customers. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This is her first loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplements to expand her food-selling business.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a responsible mother of five, Leonora needs to work hard to provide for her family. She is a widower and serves as both father and mother to her children in the absence of her spouse. She established a small business to generate an income. 

Leonora sells shoes, slippers and sandals to the people in her neighborhood. During market days in her village (which usually fall on Thursdays), she offers her products at the market where her sales capacity is increased.

Leonora is now asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional quantities of slippers, shoes and sandals to sell. She hopes that this loan will be granted to her as it is the only opportunity to progress her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of slippers, shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a mother who is blessed with seven children. While doing the household chores, she finds time to help her husband manage their corn and vegetable plantation in order to insure there is a good harvest. Despite the hardships in farming, they are able to endure because they want to earn and save to satisfy their needs and support their children's education. As responsible parents, they want to educate their children so that they are able to find good jobs someday. 

They would like to expand their corn plantation, but they have inadequate capital. Therefore, Rosemarie is asking for additional capital in the amount of 25,000 PHP to buy corn seed, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor costs required to plant corn. They believe that this loan will help them improve the business, and they hope that they will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers, insecticides and pay labor costs required to plant corn.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
Freddie is a 35-year-old married man with three children. He is a very kind and hard-working father. He does everything to provide for the basic needs of his family. His spouse is a a full-time house wife who cares for their children, and sometimes, his wife helps him to manage the farm.

Freddie is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase corn seed and fertilizer for his farm. He is a man of courage and hopes that all his plans will be granted through his determination and patience for his work.

In the future, Freddie hopes that his farm will expand to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Dorjhand

texts.en: Dorjhand is 33 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in her own house in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard and helps with her business. Her three elder kids are school students and the other one goes to kindergarten. She started her business in 2003 by sewing at home. She is very experienced and quite popular in the nearby area. Now that she has enough experience, she is planning to rent a counter in a market. To do so, she needs more supplies. Therefore, she is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy materials.

loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rebecca has a shop that sells fish, such as mackerel and trout. She also makes and sells snacks, such as banana cue. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell and ingredients for making snacks.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell & ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Sren

texts.en: Sren, 28, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Pre-Angkorian sites. Sren is a farmer, and her husband operates a rice threshing machine for local farmers in his village. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover family expenses. Sren is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new machine for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new threshing machine to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock.

Tessie has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Luzmabel

texts.en:
Luzmabel is a 58-year-old married woman with two school-aged children. Luzmabel is from Cebedo St. Ozamis City. 

Luzmabel operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. Luzmabel has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities. 

In 2010, Luzmabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Luzmabel is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost paid in maintenance and repair of her motorcycle. This loan would be her third loan taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the cost paid in maintenance and repair of her motorcycle

loans.name: Molly

texts.en: Molly is a hard working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional cloth and other materials for her dress making business. Molly has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from her sari-sari store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Molly dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Ada works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Ada is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetable to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Ada has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old and married with 2 children. Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 28,000  through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store. Alicia has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Alicia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 67 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Pilar has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Pilar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Pilar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Hol, 45, is married and resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Hol is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new tuk-tuk for her son to operate transportation services in the city. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a tuk-tuk for her son to operate transportation services in the city.

loans.name: Joveline

texts.en:
Joveline is an entrepreneur from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for 11 years. Joveline sells items like biscuits, coffee, and sugar to the people in her community. Joveline works hard to improve her business.

Joveline has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as rice and canned goods. Joveline hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Jackelyn

texts.en:
Jackelyn is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jackelyn has a food shop that sells chicken barbecue and fried chicken. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue and fried chicken.

Jackelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jackelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for chicken barbecue & fried chicken

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, 32, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. Chanthorn is a housewife, and her husband operates his motorbike with a trailer attached to provide transportation services. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Chanthorn is requesting a loan of USD 850 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate the business more efficiently. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Gemma has a tailoring shop where she makes and sells school and office uniforms and dresses. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Arn

texts.en:
Arn, 40, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean sites. Arn sells traditional cakes, and her husband is a tuk-tuk driver. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Arn is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more supplies to expand her cake production business. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to expand her cake production business

loans.name: Phen

texts.en:
Phen, 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Phen and her husband are farmers. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Phen is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase a motorbike for her son to commute to work. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son to commute to work.

loans.name: Rodelisa

texts.en:
Rodelisa is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Rodelisa has a retail shop that sells variety of sizes of lumber and timber. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of timber and lumber.

Rodelisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rodelisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of timber & lumber

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 28 years old and is a married woman with two children, aged 7 and 3. Lorna is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Lorna also raises pigs to fatten and sell. 

She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feeds. Lorna hopes to achieve her goals, like saving for her children's education and building a new house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and pig feeds.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak, 36, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Sopheak sells traditional medicine and her husband is a construction foreman. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Sopheak is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more construction supplements to expand her husband’s business. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplements to expand her husband's construction business.

loans.name: Saut

texts.en: Mrs. Saut is 55 years old and lives in Kompong Speu province, Cambodia. Saut has a life partner in her husband. She has five children, three of whom are living under her care. To earn a living, she operates a small business. She sells some kinds of fast food like fried bread and skewers of grilled beef in the village. From this business, she is able to earn approximately $2.50 per day to cover the daily expenses. Currently, Saut needs some funds from Kiva’s lenders in order to build a bathroom in her backyard behind her house. She is very grateful to the quick response of lenders and she is confident about paying her loan back.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in her backyard behind her house.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Gemma has a shop that sells breads, snacks and rice per kilogram. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy breads, snacks and a sack of rice.
Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, snacks and a sack of rice.

loans.name: Patty Noreen

texts.en:
Patty Noreen is 22 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the village of Malibababag. She is a responsible child. She raises hogs in order to acquire an income and help shoulder her school expenses. She is in college. Patty Noreen raises hogs to fatten and breed. She has been doing this for 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP for each hog disposed.

She wants to improve her hog-selling business and is in need of additional capital so she is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability. She is asking for 15,000 PHP. 

In the future, she would like to strenghten her business and continuously acquire profits from it.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and buy feed for sustainability.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is a 51-year-old married man with five children. He is residing at Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. 

Rogelio operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, planting and harvesting mangoes for sale to earn a living. He has been six years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

He requested a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Rogelio wants to make improvements to his house and for his children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Brylen

texts.en:
To earn a living, Brylen and her husband help each other to manage their corn farm. They are a young couple who live in a village with their parents. They planned to earn and save so that they will build their own house and live on their own. Both of them have no stable job and they are financially unstable; their parents are the ones who help provide some of their needs. In this regard, they planned to expand their corn plantation so that they will increase their yield and income.

Due to inadequate capital, Brylen is asking for an additional 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the corn farm. They believe that they will be able to improve their business if they continue to work and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the corn farm.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is married with four children.  She sells vegetables and spices in the market to earn a living.   Severina has had this business for two years.  

Each month, she earns about PHP 2,000.  She has requested a loan to purchase vegetables and spices that she will resell in the market.

Severina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative seven months.  Severina hopes to make her businessm a big success.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices that she will sells in the market.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
"Determination and patient are the principles of my life," according to Ferdinand, a 39 years old man.  

He lives in the village of La Salette province of Isabela.  His spouse is a full time wife who manages the house and their three children.  Ferdinand and his wife run a farm.

Ferdinand is asking for a loan of P 35,000 to buy sacks of seeds and fertilizer for his farm. 

He dreams that someday his farm will expand so he can offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is 39 years old, married with four children. Her oldest child is age 20.  Ma. Glenda's husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Glenda is engaged in fishing and seaweed farming.  She helps to sell their catch at the market.  She works hard to support her family. 

She requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, fishing nets and to pay school fees. 

Ma. Glenda hopes to improve her family's living conditions and sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, fishing nets and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda is 46 years old and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with five children.

To earn a living, Roseminda sells snacks to people in her village.  Roseminda earns about PHP 1,000 per month.  

Roseminda has requested a loan of 4000 to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Roseminda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months.  

In the future, Roseminda would like to expand and sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Gercita

texts.en:
Gercita is 65 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City.  She is widowed with five children. 

To earn a living, Gercita owns and operates a restaurant.  She earns about PHP 2,000 each month. 

Gercita has a requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

Gercita has been a member of PMPC for a month.  

In the future, Gercita would like to have a food stall in the market.  She is a hardworking mother and takes good care of her five children.  Gercita is honest and God fearing.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 46 years old and lives in Canal, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Marcelina has a business selling snacks. She earns about 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Marcelina has requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months. In the future, Marcelina would like to have savings for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a young single man who works as farmer in the village of La Salette in the province of Isabela. He is the one who helps his father on the farm. He is a very responsible son.

Alferdo is asking for a loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and corn seed for their farm. Alfredo hopes that their farm will expand so that he can provide the needs of his sister and brother for their studies. 

In the future, Alfredo wants to save money to have his own family someday.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow corn.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old and lives in Tinago, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is separated from her husband and has eight children.

To earn a living, Gloria has a business in which she makes salted tiny shrimp to eat. She earns about 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.  Gloria requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase ingredients to produce salted tiny shrimp food.

Gloria has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. In the future, Gloria would like to grow and sustain her business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her salted tiny shrimp food production.

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en:
Sareoun, 29, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean sites. Sareoun is a silk weaver and her husband is employed at a hotel. This couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family expenses. 

Sareoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase raw silk to produce silk products for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase raw silk to produce silk products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old and married with five children. 

To make a living, Jennifer is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products in the local community, such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many more. Jennifer has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

Jennifer is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Jose Arnel

texts.en: Jose Arnel is a 34-year-old seaweed farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He has been engaged in this business for quite some time now. Jose Arnel said having a direct buyer of seaweeds is very helpful to his business. Jose Arnel works hard to improve his income. He requested a loan to purchase seaweed seedlings and materials such as wooden pegs and straw. He hopes to purchase a fishing boat soon.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings and materials such as wooden pegs and straw

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun, 28, is a responsible and hard-working woman who has been living in the Kompong Speu province. She is a local famer, cultivating rice crops during the rainy season of the year. Besides agriculture, she keeps her time free at home to take care of her two kids. And now she intends to use this free time to earn more income at home by acting as a seamstress, yet she doesn’t have the necessary funds to buy a sewing machine and clothes for operating this business. That’s why she is coming to Kiva for support and hopes that she’ll achieve her goal through using this loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and clothes.

loans.name: Puspa Kencana Group

texts.en: After succeeding with the last loan, Ni Putu continues to borrow. She used this loan to purchase two superior piglets. She choose the superior species because they're easy to sell and the price is always high. She hopes this period will run smoothly, free from diseases, and that she'll earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy two superior variety pigs and their food

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 36, married and has four school-aged children. They live happily in a village and have a plan to uplift their status of living and to continue sending their children to school to give them a better future. Farming is one of their major sources of income- they plant corn and vegetables for sale. They have been in this business for more than eight years and usually earn a profit of PHP 28,000 in every harvest season. Their income is usually spent on their food, clothing, and children's allowances.

Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to earn more income to satisfy their family's needs. Elizabeth is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and for the labor cost required for a corn plantation. They believe that this loan will be a great help for them to expand their corn plantation and to increase their yields.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and labor required for her corn plantation

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 25 years old, married, and blessed with two children. They are all studying. Her business is a general store in their house. Mary Jane is borrowing the loan amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase inventory for her general store. She wishes that her general store would earn more to provide their family's needs and to support the financial education of their children. Mary Jane is a new member of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en: Chanthol, 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorian sites. Chanthol is a silk weaver and her husband is a recycler. This couple work so hard every day for incomes to help cover the family's expenses. Chanthol is requesting a loan of USD 750 to purchase raw silk to produce silk products for sale. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more raw silk to produce silk products for sale

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es: Ana Luz  de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda donde vende diversos productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, leche, pan entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues comercia productos de excelente calidad a muy buenos precios además de una inigualable atención a las personas que la visitan; Ana luz es una mujer emprendedora dispuesta a trabajar día y noche con el fin de alcanzar sus propósitos, para ella el secreto en su labor es la felicidad pues es así como se alcanza el éxito, quiere ver crecer su negocio y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, lácteos, embutidos, etc. Ana ya tiene un buen record crediticio y espera que le den de nuevo la oportunidad de invertir en el negocio. Ana Luz tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá fortalecer su hogar y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana Luz is 51 years old and lives with her life partner and two children. She has a grocery store where she sells various general products such as basic grains, milk, bread, as well as others. Her clientele has grown lately since she sells quality products at reasonable prices and offers them unbeatable costumer service. Ana Luz is a hardworking woman willing to work day and night to reach her goals. Her secret to working hard is being happy. She wants to see her business grow which is why she requested INTEGRAL a loan to buy basic grains, sweets, instant products, dairy products, sausages, etc. Ana already has a good credit record and hopes to be offered the opportunity again to invest in her business. Ana Luz has confidence to strengthen her home and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, sweets, instant products, dairy products, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is 48 years old and is a married man with two children. Modesto is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Modesto also runs a rice mill. He requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor of farmers he hired to till his land. Modesto works hard to improve his business and his family's quality of living. He also desires to have his children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is from the village of Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 63 years old. Salama is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Salama owns and operates a jeep transport service. (A jeep is a bus with a passenger cab.) Salama has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Salama is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase an additional transport vehicle to improve the business.

In 2009, Salama joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional transport vehicle to improve the business

location.town: Lower Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Eom

texts.en: Eom, 34, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorian sites. Eom is employed at a garment factory and her husband is motor-taxi driver. The couple works so hard every day for income to help cover the family's expenses. Eom is requesting a loan of USD 550 to purchase a new motorbike so her husband can operate his business more efficiently. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 53 years old and lives in San Antonio, Siquijor. She is married with two children. Norma has a general store to earn a living. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more inventory for her general store. Norma has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more one year. In the future, Norma would like to expand her business and able to support the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Harris

texts.en:
Harris had been operating a motorcycle transport service in his village for three years. He is 30 years old and married to Imee but the couple have not been blessed with a child. They are praying to have a child soon. 

Income generated from his business is just enough to cover their expenses for meals and the monthly electric bill. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy gasoline and for the maintenance of the motorcycle. He is facing financial difficulties at this moment so he needs additional capital.

In the future, he wants to improve his services and acquire a good income to continuously operate the smooth flow of his operation.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: María Martina

texts.es: María Martina de sesenta y seis años de edad vive con su hija. Ella posee  una pupuseria desde hace un buen tiempo en su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues es muy conocida en la zona porque prepara las pupusas más exquisitas de queso, revueltas y otra gran variedad, utiliza materiales de excelente calidad y sus precios son realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, María siempre está a la orden del cliente; ella es una mujer emprendedora con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante y alcanzar sus metas, para ella lo mas importante en el trabajo es el amor y la entrega, solo así se llega al verdadero éxito, y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como queso, chicharrón, frijoles, maíz, arroz, verduras etc. María Martina tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María Martina is 66 years old and lives with her daughter. She has had a food stall selling stuffed tortillas that she runs from home for quite a while. She has attracted a large number of clients as she is well known in the area for making delicious stuffed tortillas made with cheese, scrambled eggs and other varieties. She uses ingredients of an excellent quality, her prices are really reasonable and her service is unmatched. .Maria is always at her customers' service. She is an enterprising woman with a lot of enthusiasm to succeed and reach her goals. The most important for her is to love her work and be committed to it, oas nly then can one achieve true success. That is why she is a member of INTEGRAL. A loan will allow her to buy cheese, pork crackling, beans, corn, rice, vegetables, etc. María Martina is confident that in this way she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cheese, pork crackling, beans, corn, rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Khum

texts.en: Khum, 44, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorian sites. Khum and her husband sell cow ties and equipment. This couple work so hard every day for income to help cover the family's expenses. Khum is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase more cow ties and equipment to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more cow ties to resell

loans.name: Ana Melisa

texts.es: Ana Melisa D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería con la que sostiene el hogar, últimamente se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues prepara las tortillas más ricas del lugar, calientitas y con un servicio rápido, además que el material D. su producción es D. mucha calidad y las venD. a un precio accesible; Ana es una mujer entregada a su trabajo y le gusta mantenerse adelante D. la competencia, piensa que para cumplir metas en la vida se necesita D. constancia y dedicación pero su principal secreto es la felicidad y el amor en su labor, quiere hacer creer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor etc.; posee un buen record crediticio y está catalogada D. buena paga. Ana melisa tiene la esperanza que D. esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Ana Melisa is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband and children in their own home.  She has a tortilla making business which supports the household.  Lately she has more customers because her tortillas are the best in the area.  They are warm and served quickly, and the ingredients are top quality, not to mention the low price.  Ana is very dedicated to her work and she likes to stay ahead of the competition.  She believes she can reach her goals by being consistent and dedicated.  But her main secret is happiness and priD. in her work.  She wants to expand her business and has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to buy wholesale corn, etc.  She has a good credit record and is classified as a good borrower.  Ana Melisa hopes that this will allow her to give her family the best quality of life possible.

loans.use: To buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en: Because Ayu Ketut has already felt the benefits of raising pigs, and is supported by her husband, she continues to get loans from MUK. She will use this loan to purchase three superior piglets. This business helps her economic life. Now she can save – although not so much. Her husband is also very happy for that. Ayu Ketut has a dream to buy a motorcycle from the profit.

loans.use: to buy a superior species of pig.

loans.name: Jonabelle

texts.en:
Jonabelle is a hard working mother who aims to improve her family's standard of living and to educate all of her children. She is 36 years old and has five school-aged children. She raised her family in a rural community and the family is engaged in planting corn, vegetables and also raising livestock to generate income. She mentioned that sometimes they experienced financial difficulty due to calamities and the high cost of commodities. But being a resourceful parent, she was able to support her family. 

She planned to cultivate a 1.5 hectares of farm land for corn plantation to increase the corn's yields, but because of financial constraints she is requesting additional capital of P25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay for the labor cost required to plant corn. She believes that when she works hard and give her best her family will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and pay for the labor cost required to plant corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hens and wholesale feed.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en: Mrs. Chhay, earns a profit of $1.50 per day, and has been engaged in the agricultural business since 1990. She is the mother of four single children, and they live in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Two of her daughters help support the family’s living conditions by working as garment factory workers. Currently Chhay has bought construction supplies like bricks, columns, cement, and other necessary materials, and she is preparing to build a new house made of brick. However, she doesn’t have enough capital to hire local construction workers to build the house. This fund from Kiva will help Chhay achieve her dream of having a comfortable house for living.

loans.use: to hire local construction workers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, dresses and cosmetics.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El se dedica a la compra y venta de llantas tiene un mercado amplio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues vende llantas de muy buena calidad y a muy buen precio además que el servicio es inigualable, las personas quedan satisfechas con la atención; El es un hombre dedicado al trabajo siempre dispuesto a buscar el éxito en su vida, el piensa que el secreto mas importante en la labor es la perseverancia, ya tiene record crediticio y esta calificado como buena paga quiere hacer crecer su negocio y no piensa rendirse, es por eso que le solicita de nuevo a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar llantas por mayor. Marco Antonio tiene la confianza que de esta forma logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marco Antonio is 43 years old and lives with his common-law wife and children.  He buys and sells tires for a living and has a broad market.  He has attracted many customers with his top quality products and low prices.  He also provides a unique service and customers are very satisfied with his attentiveness.  He is dedicated to his work and always seeking success in life.  In his mind, the most important secret is perseverance.  He is classified as a good borrower on his credit record.  He wants to grow his business and not give up.  Therefore he has requested a new loan through INTEGRAL to buy wholesale tires.  Marco Antonio believes that, in this way, he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy wholesale tires.

loans.name: Harapan 1 Group

texts.en:
Popon is 47 years old and married with two children.  She is pictured in the photo standing in the middle and wearing yellow. Her children are ten years old and seven years old, in the sixth grade and first grade. She has been selling clothes on credit since 2008 around her neighborhood. The income that she gets can help her husband provide daily basic needs. 

The business is going well but sometimes the customers don't pay her on time. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia and she plans to buy more clothes to resell. She likes to do this business but sometimes it's challenging because the wholesale market where she buys the clothes is far from her house. In the future, she wants to have her own store and sell a wider variety of clothes. She hopes to have enough income to send both of her children to college so they can have a good jobs.

Other group members plan to use their loans for their businesses which include selling "ketoprak" (an Indonesian dish with vegetables and peanut sauce) and selling snacks.

loans.use: to pay for more clothes to resell to customers on credit.

loans.name: Reina De Jesús

texts.es: Reina D. Jesús D. cuarenta y seis años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida. Ella posee un taller D. confesión y venta D. ropa tiene variedad D. prendas blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones entre otros, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues realiza un trabajo excelente y confecciona la ropa al gusto D.  las personas, todo con material D. muy buena calidad a precio accesible además el servicio es inigualable; Reina es una mujer activa, con mucha energía para realizar su labor, piensa que el hombre que llega al éxito es el que se mantiene constante con entusiasmo y felicidad, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas por mayor. Reina D. Jesús tiene la confianza que así lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Reina D. Jesús is 46 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  She has a sewing shop and sells clothing. She makes a variety of blouses, skirts, shirts and trousers, among other things, based on customer orders.  She has attracted many customers with her excellent work, top quality material and low prices, and her service is unique.  Reina is an active woman with a lot of energy.  She believes that success comes from being consistent and showing enthusiasm and happiness.  She wants to expand her business and has requested a loan through INTEGRAL which she will use to buy wholesale fabric.  Reina D. Jesús trusts that this will help her proviD. economic stability to her household.

loans.use: To buy wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon, 62, the mother of six children, is a local rice cultivator from Kompong Speu province. Since her husband passed away, she has worked hard to raise her children alone but the family’s condition is not so good. Currently, some of her daughters work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. They are honest with their mother and regularly send a part of their salary home to help meet the financial needs. In the past few months, one of her children got engaged to be married in December, but Suon has inadequate capital to prepare for this wedding ceremony. Now she would like to ask for some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for the wedding expenses. She would like to say thanks to all lenders for their kind help.

loans.use: to pay for the wedding expenses.

loans.name: Egamkul

texts.ru: Эгамкул в бизнесе с 2001 года. Он женат и имеет двух несовершеннолетних детей. Он организовал семейное дехканское хозяйство «Озод», где пайщиками является он и его жена. Он выращивает лук и другие сельскохозяйственные культуры. Эгамкул хочет дать детям хорошие образование, чтобы они после окончания ВУЗ-а стали хорошим специалистом. Для этого он хочет увеличить бизнес и получить большой доход. Приобретенный доход хочет использовать для приобретения компьютера и расходовать для обучения и воспитания детей. Эгамкул запрашивает займ для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Egamkul has been in business since 2001.  He is married and has two adolescent children.  He organized a family dekhan farm, called "Ozod," where he and his wife are partners.  Egamkul grows onions and other agricultural crops.  He wants to provide his children with a good education, so that they could become good specialists after finishing universities.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profit for this purpose.  He plans to use the received profit to buy a computer and spend it on his children's education and rearing.  Egamkul is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mabati (iron sheeting) for roofing of the classrooms.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil is 38 years old and married. He is engaged in a small farming business in the village of La Salette. He plants crops like corn. Gil is a very hardworking person. He lives with his wife and children. His plan for the future is to improve their living conditions. 

Gil has been a corn farmer for several years. The greatest problem he faces is not having enough economic resources to provide better care for his crops. This is because he lacks fertilizers and other necessary farm supplies for better production. That's why he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizer to grow in his farm

loans.name: Rodante

texts.en: Rodante is involved in growing agricultural crops. He is married and has three child. He grows corn. His wife helps him in this business, and they work well together. Rodante wants to expand his business and maximize his profit. He wants to use the resulting profit to build a house. Rodante is requesting a loan in the sum of P 15,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Umidchon

texts.ru: Умидчон проживает в городе Худжанд. У него имеется собственная пекарня, где он печет лепешки. В этой области он 12 лет. Умидчон женат. Ему 35 лет. У него четверо детей. Он берет кредит для приобретения дров и угля.
texts.en: Umidchon lives in the town of Khujand.  He owns a bakery, where he makes flatbread.  He has been in this business for 12 years.  Umidchon is 35 years old, married and has four children.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of firewood and coal.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and coal

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 30 years old and lives in Tongo, Siquijor. She is married with four school aged children. Evelyn has a general store and earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase more inventory for her general store. Evelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 10 months. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for general store

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer lives and works in La Salette. He is involved in agriculture and grows corn. Elmer has land, and he plants corn twice a year. He has been in the agricultural business for nine years now. Elmer plans to use the loan of P 15,000 to buy seed and fertilizer. This will allow him to expand his business and increase his income.
 
In the future, Elmer hopes that he can expand his farm to improve the living condition of his parents.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 45 years old and lives in Upper Salug Daku, Mahayag. He is married with four children.
Roger works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for eight months. He has requested a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more fish to sell.
Roger has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Roger hopes to earn money each day in preparation for his monthly payment.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Boimurod

texts.ru: Боймурод уважаемый житель своего села. Он примерный семьянин. У него единственный сын. На протяжении многих лет он вместе с женой растили своего сына. Они сделали все для него. А теперь он взрослый и помогает отцу в ведении хозяйства. От полученного дохода от откорма скота и ее продажи они обустроили свой дом. В столь нелегкие времена для откорма скота тоже требуется огромный вклад. Для этого нужно закупить корма, построить хлев, закупить скот. Он хочет получить займ для увеличения доходов и расширения бизнеса. Займ ему нужен для приобретения несколько голов крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарен вам, ведь в мире есть добрые люди, которые делают добро.
texts.en: Boimurod is a respected resident of his village.  He is an exemplary family man, who has one son.  Boimurod and his wife have been raising their son for many years and did everything for him, and now that their son is grown, he helps his father with running the business.  They used their earned income from fattening up livestock and its sales to make repairs to their house.  A lot of investment is required for fattening up livestock, especially in hard times like now.  It requires purchases of fodder, building of a barn and purchase of livestock.  Boimurod wants to obtain this loan to increase his income and expand his business.  He needs the loan to buy several heads of cattle.  He relies on your support and thanks you because there are people in the world, who show kindness.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is 45 years old and married. Feliciano is a very responsible and loving person. He is engaged in raising crops. He plants corn.

Feliciano is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of corn. This means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate his two children. Feliciano has been characterized as a person who is hard working since he has been working in agriculture for seven years. This kind of work requires effort, dedication, and above all, strength. Agriculture can also include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Feliciano is determined to raise the level of living in his family and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with 3 children. Marilou is 37 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Marilou has a transport vehicle business. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase one motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business. Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

In the future, Marilou hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase one motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a hardworking businessman, aged 24. He is married and blessed with a 2-year-old child. He has been running a grocery business for the last two years to support his family. He also is employed. Elijah has employed one person to assist him to manage the business. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy carrots, tomatoes and fruit for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy carrots, tomatoes and fruit

loans.name: Tokotsun

texts.ru:
Токтосун 59 лет, замужем.  Вместе с мужем воспитали двоих детей. Токтосун долгое время работала швеей на производстве, эта профессия и сейчас помогает ей получать небольшую прибыль от пошива национальных изделий для свадеб.  
 Основная деятельность семьи Токтосун – это откорм и перепродажа скота и полеводство.  Начатое еще в 1992 году с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), хозяйство сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов.   В данный момент, семья Токтосун обрабатывает 1,20 га орошаемой земли , где выращивают картофель и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Токтосун обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. Доходы от кредита Токтосун планирует вложить в посев фасоли, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Tokotsun is 59 years old and married. She is raising two children with her husband. Tokotsun has been working as a seamstress for a long time and this trade is still helping her earn some income from periodically sewing traditional Kyrgyz wedding dresses. But now the main occupation of Tokotsun is raising livestock and produce sales. This business was started in 1992 with a starting capital of 5,000 som (KGS) and now it yields profits of 5,000 som (KGS) monthly, mainly from dairy sales. Tokotsun's family is currently farming a 3 acre plot of irrigated land where they grow potatoes and perennial grasses. In order to expand her herd and purchase more animals, Tokotsun has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS). She is planing to use the profits from a larger herd to plant beans on their farm.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mindanella

texts.en:
Mindanella is 56 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is widowed with two children.

Mindanella has a business weaving Nipa palm leaves and earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase housing materials for completion of her house.

Mindanella has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials (galvanized iron sheets, plywood, nails)

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Gulnigor

texts.ru: Гулнигор жительница города Куляб. Ей 41 год. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Гулнигор открыла столовую, где работает поваром. В этой области она 10 лет. Кредит берет для улучшения качества обслуживания.
texts.en: Gulnigor lives in the city of Kulob. She is 41 years old, widowed and has three children. Gulnigor has opened a cafe where she works as a cook. She has been working as a cook for the last 10 years. She is taking out this loan to improve her cafe by buying new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Medel

texts.en:
Medel is 37 years old and married to Jeanette. He is engaged in a farming business and grows corn to sell. Farming is the main source of his income. Medel is hard-working person. 

Medel is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seed corn and fertilizer. This will allow him to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 33 years old and lives in Taculing, Larena, Siquijor.  She is married with one child.

Jean sells food everyday and she earns 4,000 PHP a month doing this type of work.  She requested a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for food vending in the market.

Jean has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 7 months.  In the future, Jean hopes to have a savings deposit out of the profit from her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food vending in the market

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. She has been running a cafeteria for the last three years to support her family. She employs one person to help her in the business. 

Since Caroline joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With 20,000 Kenya shillings, she intends to buy ingredients, such as cooking fat, salt and cabbages.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as cooking fat, cabbages and salt

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 58 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and has 4 adult children.

Angelita sells caught fish for a living.  She has been doing this for 18 years. She earns 6,000 PHP each month.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Angelita has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Angelita hopes to sustain her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a 57-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her husband works as a Barangay official.

Carmelita runs a retail shop located near her town's market. She sells clothing items like dresses for kids, jeans and shirts. Each month, Carmelita earns 10,000 PHP with her business.

Carmelita has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers. Carmelita is hopeful that this loan will help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shirts, jeans and slippers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with five children. For the last 30 years, she has been operating a tailoring business to support her family. Previously, she was employed. 

Since Grace joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more fabric. In the next five years, she wants to become an employer. Grace dreams of buying a piece of land in future.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 44-years-old and married with 1 child who is currently going to school. Adelfa works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Adelfa has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, sardines, soap etc.. 

In the future Adelfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell  in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is a 42-year-old married woman from Nocnocan, Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store business. She sells items like shampoo and soap, vinegar, and coffee. Mary Jane works hard to earn an income and support her family. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and soap. She hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and soap.

loans.name: Mirzomahmud

texts.ru: Мирзомахмуд, молодой семьянин. Отец одного ребенка. Его сыну всего один год. Он любит свою жену и детей. Для того чтобы поставить на ноги сына, дать ему образование и хорошее воспитание ему придется много работать. Работа его ему по душе. Он этим видом бизнеса еще занимался в детстве и имеет немалый опыт. У него крупный рогатый скот. Он хочет получить займ для расширения бизнеса приобретения скота и для дальнейшего откорма с последующей продажей. Он знает, что добрые люди всегда протянут руку помощи  и поддержат его в получении займа. Он заранее благодарен всем и надеется на поддержку. Спасибо.
texts.en: Mirzomahmud is a young family man.  He is a father of one child -  a son, who is only one years old.  Mirzomahmud loves his wife and child. Mirzomahmud has to work a lot in order to raise his son, provide him with education and good upbringing.  He loves his work and has done it since childhood, and, thus, has good experience.  He owns cattle.  Mirzomahmud wants to obtain this loan to expand his business by buying livestock for fattening up and sale.  He knows that kind people will always extend a helping hand and support him in obtaining this loan.  He thanks everyone in advance and hopes to get the support.  Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and blessed with three children; two of them are in school. He has been operating a taxi business for the past two years to support his family. He also has a motorbike transport business to bring in more income.  Julius has been able to build his business because of a good reputation with his customers. 

He has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare vehicle parts. In the next five years, he plans to expand his business. He expresses  gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ameleta

texts.en:
Ameleta is 40-years-old and married with 6 children.

Ameleta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a electronic inventory business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell.

Ameleta has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the electronic selling business for 7 years and also earns an income from photocopying.

Ameleta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to continue her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 53-years-old and married with 4 children.

Ana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

Ana has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
From Kompong Speu province, Svay is 34-years-old and is in the business of cultivating rice crops alongside his wife. This couple is blessed with a lovely goat kid who is under their care. His wife, 20, helps him in earning income by selling biscuits, sweets and cakes for children in a local school. Together, they are able to generate a profit of $3.00 per day to satisfy the family’s needs. 

Svay wants to update the way he does farming by using a plowing machine instead of the animal’s force which will save him time and be easier on the animal. Moreover, he will be able to make more profit by hiring this plowing machine out to his neighbors and villagers in exchange for money. He hopes that Kiva’s lenders will support his business and will not reject his first loan. In his prospect, he wants to expand his farmland and grow additional rice crops throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is married and blessed with two children, all of whom attend school. For the past seven years, he has been operating a business selling household utensils such as cooking pans, spoons and plates. He employs one person to assist him in running the business. 

Eliud is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking pans, stoves and basins for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business into wholesale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more business-oriented.

loans.use: to buy cooking pans, stoves and basins

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie is a single mother of one school-age child.  She is 42 years old and lives in Cabulihan, Larena, Siquijor. Reggie is a farmer and raises pigs in her backyard to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 1 year.  Each month she earns about PHP 2,500 doing this type of work.  

She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase feeds and medicines for her pigs. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 1 year.  In the future, Reggie hopes to sustain her business and be able to support her child who is studying now.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 17 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business. In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a mini-hardware store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. She has been running the mini-hardware for 11 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She has borrowed and paid back 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. Christina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Ellilibeth

texts.en: Ellilibeth is 36 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.
